commit_message:
Allow user to specify private SSH key

This change allows insert user specified private ssh key for ironic.
This is required for ansible deploy driver, and can be useful for
another ssh based drivers.

Change-Id: I203963c9aefa55e9c88f2a37e43b3ef440d02e23

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-17 07:28:57.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Fix *-ceph-* job for manage snapshot tests failure

There is no snapshot manage feature on ceph backend and
tests for the same should be skipped on ceph jobs.

There is devstack variable to do so.

Currently gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph-plugin-src-glance_store-ubuntu-xenial
is failing and blocking glance-store
Details:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/110257.html

This commit sets TEMPEST_VOLUME_MANAGE_SNAPSHOT to False for ceph jobs.

Change-Id: Ie3eca6db5c76153d46e4dfbe9b552e4025347d31
'}]
commit_message:
Fix *-ceph-* job for manage snapshot tests failure

There is no snapshot manage feature on ceph backend and
tests for the same should be skipped on ceph jobs.

There is devstack variable to do so.

Currently gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph-plugin-src-glance_store-ubuntu-xenial
is failing and blocking glance-store
Details:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/110257.html

This commit sets TEMPEST_VOLUME_MANAGE_SNAPSHOT to False for ceph jobs.

Change-Id: Ie3eca6db5c76153d46e4dfbe9b552e4025347d31

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-15 07:42:16.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/swarm/fragments/write-swarm-agent-service.sh'], 'message': '[swarm] Fix cert filename in swarm-agent service

In swarm nodes the docker certs are named server.crt and server.key.
Replace filenames in swarm-agent service from client to server.

Change-Id: Ic3bc228d98c3829b583403156d8ad3ad4939037a
PArtially-Implements: blueprint secure-etcd-cluster-coe
'}]
commit_message:
[swarm] Fix cert filename in swarm-agent service

In swarm nodes the docker certs are named server.crt and server.key.
Replace filenames in swarm-agent service from client to server.

Change-Id: Ic3bc228d98c3829b583403156d8ad3ad4939037a
PArtially-Implements: blueprint secure-etcd-cluster-coe

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 6938, 'name': 'Alexey Ovchinnikov', 'email': 'aovchinnikov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aovchinnikov'}, {'_account_id': 8056, 'name': 'Ramana Raja', 'email': 'rraja@redhat.com', 'username': 'Ram_Raja'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 11047, 'name': 'Mark Sturdevant', 'email': 'mark.sturdevant@ibm.com', 'username': 'markstur'}, {'_account_id': 14567, 'name': 'Rodrigo Barbieri', 'email': 'rodrigo.barbieri@canonical.com', 'username': 'ganso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2017-01-16 15:40:11.000000000', 'files': ['bin/manila-image-create', 'README.rst', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enables end user to pick share protocol

This patch set refactors manila-image-create script to allow
end users to pick which share protocol install on their images.
This change slightly affects the current behavior of the script.

If an image is created using tox -e buildimage (as stated by current
docs) an Ubuntu Trusty Minimal image with NFS will be created.

Now, calling manila-image-create with params, will generate an image with
the filesystem protocol desired.

Change-Id: I0419cbf9a39290d32409f7a5ab9dfaf5ca636bb7
Closes-Bug: #1643034
'}]
commit_message:
Enables end user to pick share protocol

This patch set refactors manila-image-create script to allow
end users to pick which share protocol install on their images.
This change slightly affects the current behavior of the script.

If an image is created using tox -e buildimage (as stated by current
docs) an Ubuntu Trusty Minimal image with NFS will be created.

Now, calling manila-image-create with params, will generate an image with
the filesystem protocol desired.

Change-Id: I0419cbf9a39290d32409f7a5ab9dfaf5ca636bb7
Closes-Bug: #1643034

In the Ironic multi-tenant case, the neutron ports will remain unbound
until later in the deploy process. Nova generates the network_data.json
file with all the links marked as unbound, which we need to correct as

commit_message:
Ensure we mark baremetal links as phy links

In the Ironic multi-tenant case, the neutron ports will remain unbound
until later in the deploy process. Nova generates the network_data.json
file with all the links marked as unbound, which we need to correct as
these links will be bound after the config drive is generated and
written to the node. This patch updates the Ironic virt driver to
correct the network metadata.

Change-Id: I6a8e1ccc23ac5f83b414ef66b8b8a54478bd905c
Closes-Bug: #1656854

subject: Allow nova_compute & nova_compute_ironic together
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 14:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/nova/tasks/start_compute.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/start_controllers.yml'], 'message': "Allow nova_compute & nova_compute_ironic together

Currently (it appears, by design - bp ironic-compute-container),
nova_compute won't be started if ironic is enabled. This is because the
two compute containers cannot run side by side on the same node.

However, the nova-compute-ironic group is actually bound to the control
nodes in the inventory, so unless I'm missing something there's no
reason we can't start up both nova_compute and nova_compute_ironic as
they're on separate nodes.

Change-Id: I739555c71ae52f7a1fa5ccc90ed222a0f972d57d
Closes-Bug: #1644843
"}]
commit_message:
Allow nova_compute & nova_compute_ironic together

Currently (it appears, by design - bp ironic-compute-container),
nova_compute won't be started if ironic is enabled. This is because the
two compute containers cannot run side by side on the same node.

However, the nova-compute-ironic group is actually bound to the control
nodes in the inventory, so unless I'm missing something there's no
reason we can't start up both nova_compute and nova_compute_ironic as
they're on separate nodes.

Change-Id: I739555c71ae52f7a1fa5ccc90ed222a0f972d57d
Closes-Bug: #1644843

commit_message:
Add fake Keystone V3 API handlers

Keystone V2 API is deprecated, V3 should be used instead. This
commit adds fake Keystone V3 API handlers which can be used by
Fuel UI and Fuel CLI for development and functional tests.

Change-Id: If201c247210131ce6ab192362eada250a4f51ce1
Partial-Bug: #1628445
(cherry picked from commit 5c8cbd26e3daaef733b3482197f2abd9cd40656d)

subject: Restart neutron services on neutron config change
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 12199, 'name': 'Igor Gajsin', 'email': 'igajsin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'igajsin'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-16 11:27:32.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_network/plugins/ml2.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/lib/puppet/parser/functions/is_file_updated.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/agents/metadata_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_network/agents/dhcp.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_network/agents/metadata.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/plugins/ml2_spec.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/agents/dhcp_spec.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/agents/l3_spec.rb', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/server-config_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_network/agents/l3.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/openstack-network/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_network/server_config.pp'], 'message': "Restart neutron services on neutron config change

There are many neutron tasks, e.g.: common-config and network-plugins-l2.
Normally the common-config configures neutron.conf and then plugns-l2 starts
the ovs-agent.

But there is the wrong behaviour when new controllers are added to an
environment:
  1. configure and deploy an env.
  2. common-config configures neutron.conf
  3. plugins-l2 starts ovs-agent.
  4. add new controllers to the env and redeploy it.
  5. common-config configures neutron.conf.
  6. plugins-l2 knows nothing about changes in the config.

So ovs-agent isn't restarted and works with old configuration data.

This commit makes neutron tasks check md5 hash of neutron.conf and
restart them when config is changed.

(cherry-picked from 5912ee7ea5715f17f2188c3eb9c814867c9af571)
Change-Id: Ia26f4a5105407ce322a5185455093d69a938edfc
Closes-bug: #1613724
"}]
commit_message:
Restart neutron services on neutron config change

There are many neutron tasks, e.g.: common-config and network-plugins-l2.
Normally the common-config configures neutron.conf and then plugns-l2 starts
the ovs-agent.

But there is the wrong behaviour when new controllers are added to an
environment:
  1. configure and deploy an env.
  2. common-config configures neutron.conf
  3. plugins-l2 starts ovs-agent.
  4. add new controllers to the env and redeploy it.
  5. common-config configures neutron.conf.
  6. plugins-l2 knows nothing about changes in the config.

So ovs-agent isn't restarted and works with old configuration data.

This commit makes neutron tasks check md5 hash of neutron.conf and
restart them when config is changed.

(cherry-picked from 5912ee7ea5715f17f2188c3eb9c814867c9af571)
Change-Id: Ia26f4a5105407ce322a5185455093d69a938edfc
Closes-bug: #1613724

commit_message:
RBD: Fix RBD replication on volumes from image source.

When copying an image to a replicated volume, cinder will create a
new volume, then copy the image to the new volume, and delete the
old volume, so replication is disabled for the volume.

Change-Id: I4df249ae752b46e4eb5afab142947db04793b585
Closes-Bug: #1654471
(cherry picked from commit a2de8576bd9b78bbf3f033c7fad51a996bf49c4d)

commit_message:
Restart neutron services on neutron config change

There are many neutron tasks, e.g.: common-config and network-plugins-l2.
Normally the common-config configures neutron.conf and then plugns-l2 starts
the ovs-agent.

But there is the wrong behaviour when new controllers are added to an
environment:
  1. configure and deploy an env.
  2. common-config configures neutron.conf
  3. plugins-l2 starts ovs-agent.
  4. add new controllers to the env and redeploy it.
  5. common-config configures neutron.conf.
  6. plugins-l2 knows nothing about changes in the config.

So ovs-agent isn't restarted and works with old configuration data.

This commit makes neutron tasks check md5 hash of neutron.conf and
restart them when config is changed.

(cherry-picked from 5912ee7ea5715f17f2188c3eb9c814867c9af571)
Change-Id: Ia26f4a5105407ce322a5185455093d69a938edfc
Closes-bug: #1613724

commit_message:
Restart neutron services on neutron config change

There are many neutron tasks, e.g.: common-config and network-plugins-l2.
Normally the common-config configures neutron.conf and then plugns-l2 starts
the ovs-agent.

But there is the wrong behaviour when new controllers are added to an
environment:
  1. configure and deploy an env.
  2. common-config configures neutron.conf
  3. plugins-l2 starts ovs-agent.
  4. add new controllers to the env and redeploy it.
  5. common-config configures neutron.conf.
  6. plugins-l2 knows nothing about changes in the config.

So ovs-agent isn't restarted and works with old configuration data.

This commit makes neutron tasks check md5 hash of neutron.conf and
restart them when config is changed.

Change-Id: Ia26f4a5105407ce322a5185455093d69a938edfc
Closes-bug: #1613724

Tables for saving resource changes are introduced.

info changes.

Change-Id: I5406be1b68f561d90ff0ca11e8e0ac7ab45096ee

commit_message:
PoC for data versioning of installation info

Tables for saving resource changes are introduced.
In table 'history' we save JSON representation of diff, that should
be applied to the original data to restore the previous object state.

For diff calculation we are introducing 'history_last_snapshot' table.
In this table we are store the full snapshot of tracked resource.

For restoring resource state diffs from 'history' table should be
applied to the 'last snapshot' from newest to oldest.

Data versioning imlementation is abstract and can be applied for
any resource type. Here we are using it for tracking installation
info changes.

Change-Id: I5406be1b68f561d90ff0ca11e8e0ac7ab45096ee

commit_message:
Enabling logging in PostgreSQL

We need to have detailed DB transaction log for catching the
deadlocks. This change is required only for build custom ISO
and run system tests against it.

Related-Bug: #1580589

commit_message:
SSL entry points for fuelclient added

We need to have tuningbox service working over HTTP and HTTPS.
For handling HTTPS service we add appropriate endpoint to the
keystone configuration in the puppet manifests. For handling
fuel2 commands we add entry points to the tuningbox.

Change-Id: I9da33da8cfcc0ec6b9b60205e0755b6ebc8c8f9f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-03 15:57:49.000000000', 'files': ['tuning_box/cli/base.py', 'tuning_box/fuelclient.py', 'tuning_box/tests/cli/test_resource_definitions.py', 'tuning_box/cli/__init__.py', 'tuning_box/cli/resource_definitions.py', 'tuning_box/tests/cli/test_environments.py', 'tuning_box/tests/cli/test_help.py', 'tuning_box/cli/resources.py', 'tuning_box/tests/cli/test_resources.py', 'tuning_box/tests/cli/test_components.py', 'tuning_box/tests/cli/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Force loading of tuningbox.cli entry points removed

The force loading of entry points inside the Python code affects
order of loaded entry points. In this case we have wrong
entry points loaded if python-clifftab package is installed.
Unrequired entry points 'tuningbox.cli' removed.
Unused tests removed.
Client tests refactored.

Change-Id: Iea22c6c7539b89025de229a360bca08918219766
Closes-Bug: #1628508

commit_message:
Force loading of tuningbox.cli entry points removed

The force loading of entry points inside the Python code affects
order of loaded entry points. In this case we have wrong
entry points loaded if python-clifftab package is installed.
Unrequired entry points 'tuningbox.cli' removed.
Unused tests removed.
Client tests refactored.

Change-Id: Iea22c6c7539b89025de229a360bca08918219766
Closes-Bug: #1628508

commit_message:
[install] Fixes change to unix_socket authentication

This is an Ubuntu only change. Ubuntu now uses the unix_socket
authentication plugin. Corrects the way users authenticate
to the mariadb server.

Change-Id: I4642b40487f4f272be93a71cf259c3c100ea3c3c
Closes-Bug: #1654663
Closes-Bug: #1647848

commit_message:
Port xenapi test_vm_utils to Python 3

* we can't compare str and int in Python 3, and code make sure
  product_version must be a tuple of 3 integers[1], so we can remove
  invalid tests.

* Set correct exception type to catch

[1]https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/3304115b73ace6b3336c4f80f70de4661d3b1ef6/nova/virt/xenapi/client/session.py#L173

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Change-Id: I0ba1e1f2ef37ade9bdc6d19066e4a33a07246416

subject: Move not provisioned nodes to error status
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-16 12:09:31.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/provision.rb', 'spec/unit/provision_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Move not provisioned nodes to error status

When there are lot of nodes to provision and we provision
them by chunks, we could fail in the middle due to "Too many
nodes failed to provision". If so, we need to append those
nodes where we did not started provision at all to the list
of failed nodes. Otherwise, those nodes will be reported
as 'provisioned' with progress = 100 and rebooted.
But for some reasons we bind all nodes before starting provision
to debian-installer profile in cobbler, and being rebooted
these not provisioned nodes will fail to boot, because since
7.0 we put empty files where cobbler expects debian-installer
kernel and initrd files. :-)

Change-Id: I2a401b80614ee7dd5a10931b9b50bcff066f790f
Closes-Bug: #1656269
(cherry picked from commit 570049ca1fde98ee09952075f72bc4f28b9d8b71)
'}]
commit_message:
Move not provisioned nodes to error status

When there are lot of nodes to provision and we provision
them by chunks, we could fail in the middle due to "Too many
nodes failed to provision". If so, we need to append those
nodes where we did not started provision at all to the list
of failed nodes. Otherwise, those nodes will be reported
as 'provisioned' with progress = 100 and rebooted.
But for some reasons we bind all nodes before starting provision
to debian-installer profile in cobbler, and being rebooted
these not provisioned nodes will fail to boot, because since
7.0 we put empty files where cobbler expects debian-installer
kernel and initrd files. :-)

Change-Id: I2a401b80614ee7dd5a10931b9b50bcff066f790f
Closes-Bug: #1656269
(cherry picked from commit 570049ca1fde98ee09952075f72bc4f28b9d8b71)

commit_message:
Remove old ControllerConfig override from puppet-pacemaker.yaml

Previously we had to override the location of the manifest file
pushed on the controller nodes when deploying with Pacemaker, this is
not needed anymore with composable roles.

Change-Id: I1e010099263a325d06483f498c70582b008c31e2

commit_message:
Delete the tap-metadata device when it exists in the system

The existing tap-metadata device causes failure of service
startup. We first check its existance and re-initialize the
environment when necessary.

Change-Id: I9d6f1262909ee461e5891a023f7394565a12f91b
Closes-Bug: #1656500

subject: Correct print pattern in rest_client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-17 02:52:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/common/rest_client.py'], 'message': 'Correct print pattern in rest_client

The statement:
    pattern = """Unexpected http success status code {0},
                 The expected status code is {1}"""

will print more spaces than expected, something like:
Details: Unexpected http success status code 200,
                         The expected status code is [204]

This is to fix it.

Change-Id: If4a299828dce4a835d5d178deff09e01950a8915
'}]
commit_message:
Correct print pattern in rest_client

The statement:
    pattern = """Unexpected http success status code {0},
                 The expected status code is {1}"""

will print more spaces than expected, something like:
Details: Unexpected http success status code 200,
                         The expected status code is [204]

This is to fix it.

Change-Id: If4a299828dce4a835d5d178deff09e01950a8915

Nodes should be online for redeploy

subject: Suppress some bashate warnings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-16 19:05:50.000000000', 'files': ['tools/run_bashate.sh', 'elements/manila-ssh/environment.d/50-manila-user'], 'message': 'Suppress some bashate warnings

When running ``tox`` for manila image elements bashate warnings
are emitted for lines that are too long.  Suppress these since
we have no intention of enforcing that requirement.  Also add a
shebang to the top of a shell script, which does no harm (even
though it is not needed when sourcing the script to set env files)
in order to make another warning go away.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7f2f2723f99d64a0e28b4d0fe43b79e7201f6121
'}]
commit_message:
Suppress some bashate warnings

When running ``tox`` for manila image elements bashate warnings
are emitted for lines that are too long.  Suppress these since
we have no intention of enforcing that requirement.  Also add a
shebang to the top of a shell script, which does no harm (even
though it is not needed when sourcing the script to set env files)
in order to make another warning go away.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7f2f2723f99d64a0e28b4d0fe43b79e7201f6121

commit_message:
Allow to disable glance registry in tripleo

Glance v1 has been deprecated and the registry service is likely going
to be deprecated as well. At the very least, it has become an optional
service for Glance.

This patch adds the mechanism to disable the glance registry service.

Depends-On: Ib9f511219e8cb9a7322745b6bd7c4f9c9cc0c198
Change-Id: Idc7aa341ebb5d7676c2d5912a2ea61a5c8d4bc49

commit_message:
k8s devref: delve deeper into watcher/translator

This patch goes into more detail about how the Resource watchers and the
translators they call interact and which Kubernetes API primitives (like
resourceVersion and Patching) they should use.

Change-Id: I74c362d74720009120ccbf9580fae0da1cc47982
Signed-off-by: Antoni S. Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Add action plan SUPERSEDED state

An action plan can be now go to SUPERSEDED state if another
action plan is on going for instance. It could be the case with
tempest test, because we can have several scenario tests running
at the same time.

Change-Id: I5449e545676463f0ea601e67993e9dffa67929a7
Closes-bug: #1657031

subject: Need not add ext gw router ip to peer nat_addresses options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 06:34:27.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py'], 'message': 'Need not add ext gw router ip to peer nat_addresses options

Nat-addresses in lsp column are used for GARP.
GARP will be sent for router port IP itself, thus only nat-addresses for
floating IP are necessary.

Change-Id: I8c6ecda0f090bc32bbf34099b8a4b89ccf775e51
Closes-Bug: #1655976
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Need not add ext gw router ip to peer nat_addresses options

Nat-addresses in lsp column are used for GARP.
GARP will be sent for router port IP itself, thus only nat-addresses for
floating IP are necessary.

Change-Id: I8c6ecda0f090bc32bbf34099b8a4b89ccf775e51
Closes-Bug: #1655976
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
[ironic] Install open-iscsi package evidently

Make sure open-iscsi package has installed evidently
in order to cover standalone ironic conductor case.
Also ipmitool package has been removed since it's
installed by class of ironic::conductor.

subject: requirements.txt: Restrict Jinja2 version to < 2.9
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 15362, 'name': 'fdegir', 'display_name': 'Fatih Degirmenci', 'email': 'fdegir@gmail.com', 'username': 'fdegir'}, {'_account_id': 22474, 'name': 'OPNFV CI', 'email': 'opnfvci@gmail.com', 'username': 'opnfvci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23163, 'name': 'Markos Chandras (hwoarang)', 'email': 'markos@chandras.me', 'username': 'mchandras'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 09:37:52.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'requirements.txt: Restrict Jinja2 version to < 2.9

Upstream ansible/stable-2.1 Commit 6c6570583f6e ("Add jinja2 version
constraint.") added a Jinja2 version constrain (<2.9). Add such
a dependency requirement to the requirements.txt file to ensure that a
proper version is installed by pip. It fixes the following problem on
hosts where a higher version of Jinja2 is installed:

DistributionNotFound: The 'jinja2<2.9' distribution was not found and is
required by ansible

Change-Id: Idf967830e0f49e711225de5e82a6ae96a4fac774
'}]
commit_message:
requirements.txt: Restrict Jinja2 version to < 2.9

Upstream ansible/stable-2.1 Commit 6c6570583f6e ("Add jinja2 version
constraint.") added a Jinja2 version constrain (<2.9). Add such
a dependency requirement to the requirements.txt file to ensure that a
proper version is installed by pip. It fixes the following problem on
hosts where a higher version of Jinja2 is installed:

DistributionNotFound: The 'jinja2<2.9' distribution was not found and is
required by ansible

Change-Id: Idf967830e0f49e711225de5e82a6ae96a4fac774

commit_message:
Tags info calculation is supported on plugins update

For instance we made plugins sync operation. In this case
tags info should be processed on the same way as on plugin
creation.
Also test for tags metadata migration improved.

Change-Id: I937bb581f61034d027b28a8e4fd5b42a35fcd7f6
Closes-Bug: #1655264

Update reference for keystone

Reference for keystone should be updated to
consume manage_memcache_package option from
keystone::resource::authtoken class. This will
unblock Newton CI.

Closes-Bug: #1656764

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-16 08:22:51.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/security_groups/test_security_group_rules_negative.py', 'tempest/api/compute/security_groups/base.py', 'tempest/api/compute/security_groups/test_security_groups_negative.py'], 'message': 'Add generate_random_security_group_id in BaseSecurityGroupsTest

This is to add generate_random_security_group_id in BaseSecurityGroupsTest,
so that all security_group tests can use it.
Besides, currently there are two functions which are used to generate
not_existing_id(_generate_a_non_existent_security_group_id and
not_existing_id), because generally speaking, rand_uuid or rand_int_id
can seldom be same, so we can use the simple way to generate
not_existing_id.

Change-Id: Ib6118c74ac080b3fdd7f1e77ac37f24792793d57
'}]
commit_message:
Add generate_random_security_group_id in BaseSecurityGroupsTest

This is to add generate_random_security_group_id in BaseSecurityGroupsTest,
so that all security_group tests can use it.
Besides, currently there are two functions which are used to generate
not_existing_id(_generate_a_non_existent_security_group_id and
not_existing_id), because generally speaking, rand_uuid or rand_int_id
can seldom be same, so we can use the simple way to generate
not_existing_id.

Change-Id: Ib6118c74ac080b3fdd7f1e77ac37f24792793d57

subject: Fix *-ceph-* jobs for manage snapshot tests failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-17 05:04:43.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix *-ceph-* jobs for manage snapshot tests failure

There is no snapshot manage feature on ceph backend and
tests for the same should be skipped on ceph jobs.

There is devstack variable to do so.

Currently gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph-plugin-src-glance_store-ubuntu-xenial
is failing and blocking glance-store
Details:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/110257.html

This commit sets TEMPEST_VOLUME_MANAGE_SNAPSHOT to False for ceph jobs.
Change-Id: Ie7c0f38f842f9a2caa8f85cbc7abd29cfc775e75
'}]
commit_message:
Fix *-ceph-* jobs for manage snapshot tests failure

There is no snapshot manage feature on ceph backend and
tests for the same should be skipped on ceph jobs.

There is devstack variable to do so.

Currently gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph-plugin-src-glance_store-ubuntu-xenial
is failing and blocking glance-store
Details:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/110257.html

This commit sets TEMPEST_VOLUME_MANAGE_SNAPSHOT to False for ceph jobs.
Change-Id: Ie7c0f38f842f9a2caa8f85cbc7abd29cfc775e75

subject: Fix: all containers are being set privileged
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-16 13:42:33.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_hook_docker_cmd.py', 'heat-config-docker-cmd/install.d/hook-docker-cmd.py'], 'message': 'Fix: all containers are being set privileged

This patch simplies the check for privileged so that we treat
it as a pass through string. Previously we were converting
to a string before doing the boolean check which was causing
all containers to get set to --privileged true.

Change-Id: Ibe2221abf9616c1c54acecf7c18ae36e2c07576c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: all containers are being set privileged

This patch simplies the check for privileged so that we treat
it as a pass through string. Previously we were converting
to a string before doing the boolean check which was causing
all containers to get set to --privileged true.

Change-Id: Ibe2221abf9616c1c54acecf7c18ae36e2c07576c

commit_message:
Update Server Consolidation global efficacy

As instance migration cost is petty compared to the cost of
compute node release, I update the way to compute the global
efficacy for a server consolidation goal. The new formula is simplest
and it's only based on compute node.

Change-Id: Ibcce31a85af70429f412c96c584a761d681366a2

commit_message:
Add experimental python-tripleoclient jobs to diskimage-builder

Because of some upcoming changes to DIB, we want to make sure that
python-tripleoclient is not affected. The current tripleo jobs do to
many things. While these jobs just build images, giving shorter wait
times.

Change-Id: I9964f68656381b45de29e9b1e3baad2fd4160c02
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

the unit tests.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-25 21:18:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Instance goes to ERROR when migration set to error

There are cases where an instance is left "migrating" for ever even when
the live-migrate has long since failed. Turns out we talk to neutron in
the final phase of the live-migrate, and a Token timeout can trigger
issues there.

Closes-Bug: #1599057

Change-Id: I38c260aa73f473af36f21cd7cea4c0488f198428
'}]
commit_message:
Instance goes to ERROR when migration set to error

There are cases where an instance is left "migrating" for ever even when
the live-migrate has long since failed. Turns out we talk to neutron in
the final phase of the live-migrate, and a Token timeout can trigger
issues there.

Closes-Bug: #1599057

Change-Id: I38c260aa73f473af36f21cd7cea4c0488f198428

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-16 14:46:02.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add tripleo overcloud upgrade job to t-h-t repo check

This adds the new upgrade job to the check queue, only for the
tripleo-heat-templates repo initially (it's still available via
the experimental queue for other repos).

This has been proven via a number of experimental job passes, e.g
see:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404831 (adds support to tripleo-ci)
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412475
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/419894
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420027
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420058

I've also moved it to the experimental queue for tripleo-ci, as we
will still want to run checks on any tripleo-ci patches touching
the upgrade related code, possibly it will be needed on other repos
too in future, but it's not yet clear which ones.

Change-Id: Ib53854853700c82fae522fc52fe2e8c87a10225a

commit_message:
Add tripleo overcloud upgrade job to t-h-t repo check

This adds the new upgrade job to the check queue, only for the
tripleo-heat-templates repo initially (it's still available via
the experimental queue for other repos).

This has been proven via a number of experimental job passes, e.g
see:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/404831 (adds support to tripleo-ci)
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412475
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/419894
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420027
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/420058

I've also moved it to the experimental queue for tripleo-ci, as we
will still want to run checks on any tripleo-ci patches touching
the upgrade related code, possibly it will be needed on other repos
too in future, but it's not yet clear which ones.

Change-Id: Ib53854853700c82fae522fc52fe2e8c87a10225a

This patch updates the octavia project to have the translation jobs
and translate option.

it's new role in OpenStack.

subject: Move requirements job failure msg into log
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-16 22:21:14.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/scripts/project-requirements-change.py'], 'message': 'Move requirements job failure msg into log

A failure on the requirements job currently uses a custom
failure-message.  The problem is that this custom message doesn't
match the gerrit magic for extracting failures and showing them in the
"Jenkins check" box.

This means that jenkins votes -1, but you don't see any failures
unless you go and click the "toggle ci" button.  This leads to
confusion and people rechecking unnecessarily.

The message doesn't seem particlarly important; the linked page is
just the regular documentation and isn't exactly a trouble-shooting
guide.  Thus move the message and link into the job output so this job
remains consistent.  The message stays similar but without the link so
it matches.

Change-Id: I2af14c7993e097178c4cc7ee894804c005148523
'}]
commit_message:
Move requirements job failure msg into log

A failure on the requirements job currently uses a custom
failure-message.  The problem is that this custom message doesn't
match the gerrit magic for extracting failures and showing them in the
"Jenkins check" box.

This means that jenkins votes -1, but you don't see any failures
unless you go and click the "toggle ci" button.  This leads to
confusion and people rechecking unnecessarily.

The message doesn't seem particlarly important; the linked page is
just the regular documentation and isn't exactly a trouble-shooting
guide.  Thus move the message and link into the job output so this job
remains consistent.  The message stays similar but without the link so
it matches.

Change-Id: I2af14c7993e097178c4cc7ee894804c005148523

subject: Fix restriction for gate-tempest-dsvm(-multinode)?-full-ubuntu-xenial
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-17 00:04:55.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix restriction for gate-tempest-dsvm(-multinode)?-full-ubuntu-xenial

The regex here was too strict so that it was not matching on the -nv
on the gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv job and was
thus running that job on master (ocata) which is redundant with the
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv job since
on ocata+ they are both running neutron now (so the config is the
same).

This loosens the suffix on the regex to capture the non-voting job.

Change-Id: I1c22983f1f1fa09e1ebb6197a541f09f2cf14137
'}]
commit_message:
Fix restriction for gate-tempest-dsvm(-multinode)?-full-ubuntu-xenial

The regex here was too strict so that it was not matching on the -nv
on the gate-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv job and was
thus running that job on master (ocata) which is redundant with the
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-multinode-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv job since
on ocata+ they are both running neutron now (so the config is the
same).

This loosens the suffix on the regex to capture the non-voting job.

Change-Id: I1c22983f1f1fa09e1ebb6197a541f09f2cf14137

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-16 01:45:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py'], 'message': 'RBD: Fix RBD replication on volumes from image source.

When copying an image to a replicated volume, cinder will create a
new volume, then copy the image to the new volume, and delete the

Closes-Bug: #1654471

commit_message:
RBD: Fix RBD replication on volumes from image source.

When copying an image to a replicated volume, cinder will create a
new volume, then copy the image to the new volume, and delete the
old volume, so replication is disabled for the volume.

Change-Id: I4df249ae752b46e4eb5afab142947db04793b585
Closes-Bug: #1654471

commit_message:
To reset metadata for resources when mark unhealthy

Some resources do not work if their metadata is in
a wrong state, .e.g the metadata 'scaling_in_progress'
of scaling group/policy might be always True if engine
restarts while scaling.
This patch adds an interface 'handle_metadata_reset' for
resource, then the plugins can override it if needed.
We reset the metadata while marking resource healthy.

Closes-Bug: #1651084
(cherry picked from commit 5b04acb4e25efbea58de998278e390fb64d7c575)

Conflicts:
	heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_resources.py
Change-Id: Ibd6c18acf6f3f24cf9bf16a524127850968062bc

commit_message:
To reset metadata for resources when mark unhealthy

Some resources do not work if their metadata is in
a wrong state, .e.g the metadata 'scaling_in_progress'
of scaling group/policy might be always True if engine
restarts while scaling.
This patch adds an interface 'handle_metadata_reset' for
resource, then the plugins can override it if needed.
We reset the metadata while marking resource healthy.

Closes-Bug: #1651084
(cherry picked from commit 5b04acb4e25efbea58de998278e390fb64d7c575)

Conflicts:
	heat/scaling/cooldown.py
	heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_resources.py
Change-Id: Ibd6c18acf6f3f24cf9bf16a524127850968062bc

subject: Use tempest and tricircle in Devstack samples
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-14 00:08:01.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/local.conf.node_1.sample', 'devstack/local.conf.node_2.sample', 'devstack/local.conf.sample'], 'message': "Use tempest and tricircle in Devstack samples

1. What is the problem?
Using tempest plugin in conjuction with
NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS to set False was causing failures
during the execution of the stack.sh script. This issue was solved
in I62e74d350d6533fa842d64c15b01b1a3d42c71c2 but it hasn't reflected
on the devstack samples.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Let the users to enable or disable the tempest usage on their devstack
environments.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution?
No new features

Change-Id: Iad563a660ea58faa57984ee7829ee45e5811c900
"}]
commit_message:
Use tempest and tricircle in Devstack samples

1. What is the problem?
Using tempest plugin in conjuction with
NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS to set False was causing failures
during the execution of the stack.sh script. This issue was solved
in I62e74d350d6533fa842d64c15b01b1a3d42c71c2 but it hasn't reflected
on the devstack samples.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Let the users to enable or disable the tempest usage on their devstack
environments.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution?
No new features

Change-Id: Iad563a660ea58faa57984ee7829ee45e5811c900

commit_message:
Allow skipping manila tempest tests.

This commit allows to skip manila tempest tests when manila is set to
false in tempest.CONF service_available. This would allow to disable
manila testing in an environment where all the plugins are installed
(i.e. a package-based installation).

Change-Id: I75dd2fd86df7500ad0bc4f633ed39f7595e9dc8c
(cherry picked from commit 5dc5ecf392e4f17f8a420da5c1ff5c399d4593f7)

commit_message:
Move rabbit configurations to oslo_messaging_rabbit section

Configuration with oslo.messaging is listed in the DEFAULT section
in etc/barbican/barbican.conf.
According to this Change "I96a9682afe7eb0caf1fbf47bbb0291833aec245b"
of oslo.messaging, we now prefer to set them in "oslo_messaging_rabbit"
section.

Closes-Bug: #1590231
Change-Id: I2b952012b2192cfb95e28cf11f78cf56d6a414ca

commit_message:
Add cinder.CreateIncrementalVolumeBackup scenario

The scenario first create a volume, the create a backup, the
backup is full backup. Because Incremental backup must be based on the
full backup. finally create a incremental backup.

Change-Id: Ia9471020a0f7009288949196bd2603a4b56e7c4a

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-16 09:07:24.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/tests/unit/test_httpclient.py', 'mistralclient/api/httpclient.py'], 'message': 'Pass target insecure flag to msitral service

In case of mistral client shall use insecure https connection

connection towards target cloud. To complete that mistralclient shall

Change-Id: Idf93d968d81ae6748f89ebdf304f4db7f79a4503
'}]
commit_message:
Pass target insecure flag to msitral service

In case of mistral client shall use insecure https connection
towards cloud then other OpenStack clients shall use insecure
connection towards target cloud. To complete that mistralclient shall
pass the X-Target-Insecure header to the mistral service.

Change-Id: Idf93d968d81ae6748f89ebdf304f4db7f79a4503

subject: Change network type shared_vlan name to vlan
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-17 03:01:10.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/network/drivers/type_vlan.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_local_plugin.py', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'specs/newton/cross-pod-l2-networking.rst', 'tricircle/network/helper.py', 'tricircle/network/managers.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'releasenotes/notes/initial-release-notes-bd28a4a4bf1f84d2.yaml', 'doc/source/installation-manual.rst', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_central_plugin.py', 'specs/ocata/local-neutron-plugin.rst', 'tricircle/network/central_plugin.py', 'doc/source/multi-pod-installation-devstack.rst', 'tricircle/common/constants.py', 'tricircle/network/local_plugin.py', 'specs/ocata/l3-networking-combined-bridge-net.rst', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Change network type shared_vlan name to vlan

1. What is the problem
shared_vlan's concept is to create a network spanning into multiple
OpenStack with same vlan segment, but when create a network which only
resides in one region and the network type is vlan, we have to specify
the physical network type as shared_vlan, otherwise no other way to
create a vlan network in local Neutron.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Just use vlan as the physical network type, and use
availability_zone_hints to limit where the network will reside.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: Ib3f110e2281eff2997752debda319da282c3e3ad
"}]
commit_message:
Change network type shared_vlan name to vlan

1. What is the problem
shared_vlan's concept is to create a network spanning into multiple
OpenStack with same vlan segment, but when create a network which only
resides in one region and the network type is vlan, we have to specify
the physical network type as shared_vlan, otherwise no other way to
create a vlan network in local Neutron.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Just use vlan as the physical network type, and use
availability_zone_hints to limit where the network will reside.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: Ib3f110e2281eff2997752debda319da282c3e3ad

subject: Disable wait for force-delete
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-14 18:49:40.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/runners/__init__.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/instance_force_delete_runners.py'], 'message': "Disable wait for force-delete

In the scenario tests, sometimes the force-delete command doesn't end up
deleting the instance. This seems to be a timing issue in that it
doesn't occur during every run (and therefore might be hard to track
down). It's not terribly critical as you can run the command again and

Change-Id: Id5b041cb4d5276c5015921784526423e766d032c

commit_message:
Disable wait for force-delete

In the scenario tests, sometimes the force-delete command doesn't end up
deleting the instance. This seems to be a timing issue in that it
doesn't occur during every run (and therefore might be hard to track
down). It's not terribly critical as you can run the command again and
it will probably work the second time, but until it's fixed the test
has been disabled.

Change-Id: Id5b041cb4d5276c5015921784526423e766d032c
Related-Bug: 1656422

subject: Fix DevStack installation of blazar-nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 21:02:24.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Fix DevStack installation of blazar-nova

DevStack fails to install blazar-nova with the following error message:

    Could not satisfy constraints for 'nova': installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

This is related to DevStack bug 1540328 [1] and is triggered by the
dependency on a Nova tarball URL in test-requirements.txt:

    http://tarballs.openstack.org/nova/nova-master.tar.gz#egg=nova

This workaround is inspired by a similar change in manila [2].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1540328
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274631/

Change-Id: I46edee2b4356f7fb9e9cc6f3bdc86079792240f7
Closes-Bug: #1641577
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DevStack installation of blazar-nova

DevStack fails to install blazar-nova with the following error message:

    Could not satisfy constraints for 'nova': installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version

This is related to DevStack bug 1540328 [1] and is triggered by the
dependency on a Nova tarball URL in test-requirements.txt:

    http://tarballs.openstack.org/nova/nova-master.tar.gz#egg=nova

This workaround is inspired by a similar change in manila [2].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1540328
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274631/

Change-Id: I46edee2b4356f7fb9e9cc6f3bdc86079792240f7
Closes-Bug: #1641577

commit_message:
Gate on ironic.conf.sample generation

If someone makes a change that breaks "tox -egenconfig" like [1],
it is not caught today by any of the gate/check job, we should fail
at least docs job like what Nova does to make sure it works.

[1]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238376/

Change-Id: I90b8ce3706048e31cb9418b7bea72b55e76e8426

subject: Add new middleware to send API data to statsd
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-03 23:24:12.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/tests/test_stats.py', 'requirements.txt', 'oslo_middleware/stats.py'], 'message': "Add new middleware to send API data to statsd

The new StatsMiddleware is a Paste filter that examines the URL path and
request method, and sends a stat count and a timer to a statsd host
whose name is based on the path/method.

If your statsd is configured to send stats to Graphite, you'll end up
with stat names of the form:
timer.<appname>.<METHOD>.<path>.<from>.<url>

Because a dot has special meaning in Graphite, dots in API versions that
appear in the path will be replaced with _, so for example v2.1 becomes v2_1,
and v1.0 becomes v1_0.

Change-Id: Ieaffeded1bf81c0782d88f49b6f5209f11744899
"}]
commit_message:
Add new middleware to send API data to statsd

The new StatsMiddleware is a Paste filter that examines the URL path and
request method, and sends a stat count and a timer to a statsd host
whose name is based on the path/method.

If your statsd is configured to send stats to Graphite, you'll end up
with stat names of the form:
timer.<appname>.<METHOD>.<path>.<from>.<url>

Because a dot has special meaning in Graphite, dots in API versions that
appear in the path will be replaced with _, so for example v2.1 becomes v2_1,
and v1.0 becomes v1_0.

Change-Id: Ieaffeded1bf81c0782d88f49b6f5209f11744899

Fix _add_listener cannot get project

commit_message:
Revert "Swap volume type for migration started by retype"

This reverts commit ef98a0b1bc1ab13656e9dffec33753dfc0838752.

The refered commit is breaking retype with migration[1]. We need to
revert this and get migration working again and then rework the bug
targeted at the refered change in a way that does not add this side
effect.

[1] http://bit.ly/2gI5Xlf

Change-Id: I5fa16ad3786dd488136b821d3c2e95e41cbc4df5
Closes-bug: #1647429

commit_message:
Add OpenStackClient plugin and flavor list

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
through a plugin and tests.

The support can be demonstrated through the implementation of
the trove command flavor-list which is now:
    openstack database flavor list

Use the -v or --debug flag to see the calls being made to the correct
flavor list function.

ubuntu@ubuntu:~$ openstack database flavor list -v
START with options: [u'database', u'flavor', u'list', u'-v']
command: database flavor list -> troveclient.osc.v1.flavors.ListFlavors
Using auth plugin: password
+-----+-----------+-------+-------+------+-----------+
|  id | name      |   RAM | vCPUs | Disk | ephemeral |
+-----+-----------+-------+-------+------+-----------+
|   1 | m1.tiny   |   512 |     1 |    1 |         0 |
|   2 | m1.small  |  2048 |     1 |   20 |         0 |
|   3 | m1.medium |  4096 |     2 |   40 |         0 |
|   4 | m1.large  |  8192 |     4 |   80 |         0 |
|  42 | m1.nano   |    64 |     1 |    0 |         0 |
| 451 | m1.heat   |   512 |     1 |    0 |         0 |
|   5 | m1.xlarge | 16384 |     8 |  160 |         0 |
|  84 | m1.micro  |   128 |     1 |    0 |         0 |
|  c1 | cirros256 |   256 |     1 |    0 |         0 |
|  d1 | ds512M    |   512 |     1 |    5 |         0 |
|  d2 | ds1G      |  1024 |     1 |   10 |         0 |
|  d3 | ds2G      |  2048 |     2 |   10 |         0 |
|  d4 | ds4G      |  4096 |     4 |   20 |         0 |
+-----+-----------+-------+-------+------+-----------+
END return value: 0

Change-Id: I308a6c6f3f5ce7dbb814ec0fd8ecb1734a2f137f
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Add nova-lxd storage-pool option for ZFS storage backend

Choosing zfs storage backend for nova-lxd requires specifying
a storage pool name. This option is not in the template.
This adds an option to specify the storage pool name if a variable
has been populated with the name.

Change-Id: Ifb29545c715c93362283399d198ec9b0e77aa630
Closes-Bug: #1655064

commit_message:
Mark the sheepdog driver as unsupported

Due to licensing change concerns, along with that the CI job has been
failing for some time, the sheepdog driver is being marked as
unsupported.

For further details, see the ML discussion regarding licensing: [1]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-December/108738.html

Change-Id: I2915086cdd02f436327c2c98f07cea0cc7ecfb94

commit_message:
OVS bridges in fail-mode=secure to prevent loops

Due to race condition in OVS and neutron-ovs-agent startup sequence,
fail-mode=secure should be set on every bridge. Neutron is set this
option only on br-int, so l23network should handle other bridges.

Change-Id: I63a44dfaf7236b8b0b501bb8fd87cb1916130838
Closes-Bug: #1623056

subject: Remove yum chroot caching
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-20 02:57:03.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/yum-cache-removal-148c33012515e56e.yaml', 'elements/yum-minimal/root.d/08-yum-chroot', 'elements/fedora-minimal/README.rst', 'elements/centos-minimal/README.rst', 'elements/yum-minimal/README.rst'], 'message': "Remove yum chroot caching

Every run we are doing a full tar.gz of the chroot environment that
never gets used.

It's not suitable for CI since we use fresh images each time there.

The cache in general isn't really isn't a very safe thing to have
around, because there's no invalidation procedure and no real way to
make one -- we've no guarantee that a new chroot build even moments
after a previous one wouldn't bring in or different packages, etc (of
course this is *unlikely*, but the longer you go between builds the
worse the problem becomes.  Also, tons of packages get installed after
this not from any cache, so potential speed-up is rather marginal.

Debian turned this off with I58fc485aacacaa17243bf9ce760ed91256d1f182.
However, given the reasons above and it's complete lack of testing, I
don't see this as useful.

If we really want this type of thing, I think we should come up with a
way to use a persistent external yum/dnf cache that yum/dnf keeps in
sync with it's usual invalidation rules.

Change-Id: I66789c35db75c41bc45ea1ad2e26f87456de4e4d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove yum chroot caching

Every run we are doing a full tar.gz of the chroot environment that
never gets used.

It's not suitable for CI since we use fresh images each time there.

The cache in general isn't really isn't a very safe thing to have
around, because there's no invalidation procedure and no real way to
make one -- we've no guarantee that a new chroot build even moments
after a previous one wouldn't bring in or different packages, etc (of
course this is *unlikely*, but the longer you go between builds the
worse the problem becomes.  Also, tons of packages get installed after
this not from any cache, so potential speed-up is rather marginal.

Debian turned this off with I58fc485aacacaa17243bf9ce760ed91256d1f182.
However, given the reasons above and it's complete lack of testing, I
don't see this as useful.

If we really want this type of thing, I think we should come up with a
way to use a persistent external yum/dnf cache that yum/dnf keeps in
sync with it's usual invalidation rules.

Change-Id: I66789c35db75c41bc45ea1ad2e26f87456de4e4d

subject: Add os-dpm to global requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-16 08:34:13.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Add os-dpm to global requirements

os-dpm is a shared library for the projects nova-dpm [1] and
networking-dpm [2] which host a Nova compute driver and corresponding
Neutron drivers and agents for IBM z Systems hypervisor in DPM mode.
All the code is supposed to run on a compute node only.

- Is the library actively maintained?
  yes - it is part of the OpenStack dpm effort which is currently
  developed. It's pretty new, as the project is still in development.

- Is the library good code?
  yes. In fact there is not much code. It starts with common config
  options for the projects [1] and [2]

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  yes, python 35 test jobs in place

- Is the library license compatible?
  yes, apache 2.0 license

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
  (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
  no

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in global-requirements.txt?
  no

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?
  nova-dpm [1]
  neworking-dpm [2]

[1] https://launchpad.net/nova-dpm
[2] https://launchpad.net/networking-dpm

Change-Id: I40a4397bd75968af6f404bcffce3e8743324a971
"}]
commit_message:
Add os-dpm to global requirements

os-dpm is a shared library for the projects nova-dpm [1] and
networking-dpm [2] which host a Nova compute driver and corresponding
Neutron drivers and agents for IBM z Systems hypervisor in DPM mode.
All the code is supposed to run on a compute node only.

- Is the library actively maintained?
  yes - it is part of the OpenStack dpm effort which is currently
  developed. It's pretty new, as the project is still in development.

- Is the library good code?
  yes. In fact there is not much code. It starts with common config
  options for the projects [1] and [2]

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  yes, python 35 test jobs in place

- Is the library license compatible?
  yes, apache 2.0 license

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
  (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
  no

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in global-requirements.txt?
  no

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?
  nova-dpm [1]
  neworking-dpm [2]

[1] https://launchpad.net/nova-dpm
[2] https://launchpad.net/networking-dpm

Change-Id: I40a4397bd75968af6f404bcffce3e8743324a971

commit_message:
Change Murano Dashboard Limit for Memory and Instances

The commit changes the value of “limitIterators” to 10000 and the
“memoryQuota” to 1000000. This will increase the instance count and
memory quota that can be created in the template definition of
“UI.yaml” file.

Closes-Bug: #1640998

subject: Fixes new sanity_check tests deleting too many resources.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-12 02:28:42.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py', 'muranodashboard/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': 'Fixes new sanity_check tests deleting too many resources.

Because tests are run out of order, this will not always be
re-produced, but inevitably this bug will happen.

Right now, the test test_delete_multiple_images in TestSuiteImage
will delete all the images in tearDownClass -- including the
cls.image_id which is used by many other tests. If the
TestSuiteImage tests run before tests in another suite that
rely on cls.image_id, they will fail.

This same scenario can also happen with the recent addition
of filter component tests. These tests delete the resources
created by the test at the end of the test. But eventually, when
these tests fail, that code will not run, causing many other
tests to fail, making debugging very hard as well.

This patch adds addCleanup at the beginning of these tests so
that deletion always works and prevents the cls.image_id from
being deleted.

Change-Id: If199d560870a138d250bfba332da90e557693a03
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes new sanity_check tests deleting too many resources.

Because tests are run out of order, this will not always be
re-produced, but inevitably this bug will happen.

Right now, the test test_delete_multiple_images in TestSuiteImage
will delete all the images in tearDownClass -- including the
cls.image_id which is used by many other tests. If the
TestSuiteImage tests run before tests in another suite that
rely on cls.image_id, they will fail.

This same scenario can also happen with the recent addition
of filter component tests. These tests delete the resources
created by the test at the end of the test. But eventually, when
these tests fail, that code will not run, causing many other
tests to fail, making debugging very hard as well.

This patch adds addCleanup at the beginning of these tests so
that deletion always works and prevents the cls.image_id from
being deleted.

Change-Id: If199d560870a138d250bfba332da90e557693a03

commit_message:
Refactor DRAC driver boot-device tests

This reduces the amount of copy-and-pasting in the tests, making it more
obvious what changes between tests and what each test method is testing.
It also makes it easier to extend the tests to handle UEFI-mode boot
devices (in a followup patch).

subject: Call VF configuration from udev rules
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-11 13:32:49.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/host/sriov/numvfs_persistence.pp', 'manifests/host/sriov.pp', 'spec/defines/tripleo_host_sriov_numvfs_persistence_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Call VF configuration from udev rules

When a physical function that was allocated to a guest is released back
the system, it is not automatically brought "up" and the VF
configuration is not restored. This patch creates a file containing some
udev rules to force the VF configuration.

Note: we may find that the ifup-local script is no longer required but
this will require further testing.

Change-Id: Ie6e78730aa0a748b3b5100ab7c7bc007d8ab176d
Partial-Bug: #1639901
'}]
commit_message:
Call VF configuration from udev rules

When a physical function that was allocated to a guest is released back
the system, it is not automatically brought "up" and the VF
configuration is not restored. This patch creates a file containing some
udev rules to force the VF configuration.

Note: we may find that the ifup-local script is no longer required but
this will require further testing.

Change-Id: Ie6e78730aa0a748b3b5100ab7c7bc007d8ab176d
Partial-Bug: #1639901

commit_message:
Include swift::storage::loopbacks class

This makes it possible to create loopback devices for Swift by using
additional Hieradata. For example, to create a 100M loopback device that
will be mounted on /srv/node/d1:

  parameter_defaults:
    ControllerExtraConfig:
      swift::storage::loopbacks::args: {"d1": {'seek': '100000'}}

Depends-On: I11a230b7cf08a4cc2a144d9af0e6c81bb3827348
Change-Id: I8741acc8afa1f1d23c5b25fa4bf27622f674a561

commit_message:
init: allow to configure rbd_default_features

Allow puppet-ceph to configure rbd_default_features parameter in
ceph.conf / [client] section. Operators deploying newer Ceph clients
that must use older Ceph servers need to be able to easily set this
option for backwards compatibility.

Depends-On: I3242cfe0f141fe2bbb951ce2cf7071fd07456db8
Change-Id: I477640c5db2cc84622da7734fb54cfe7740bd137
Partial-Bug: 1633552

commit_message:

flavors of test.small-3. These need to be changed to test.small-4 to fix
the gate.

The defaults for PXC and Percona were also changes, just to make
sure (MariaDB was already there).

subject: Pass rbd_default_features to puppet-ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-13 21:11:16.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/ceph.pp'], 'message': 'Pass rbd_default_features to puppet-ceph

The rbd_default_features extra configs parameter was removed from
this module as per I3242cfe0f141fe2bbb951ce2cf7071fd07456db8 so that,
as per I95cafec9160f5c3b1610a0408f2f80d567fcaa89, puppet-ceph could

parameter to puppet-ceph with a value of 15, the same value that this
module used to use for performance reasons.

Change-Id: I1810b0e58c47f3827b6396c039eb9a32510a7993

commit_message:
Pass rbd_default_features to puppet-ceph

The rbd_default_features extra configs parameter was removed from
this module as per I3242cfe0f141fe2bbb951ce2cf7071fd07456db8 so that,
as per I95cafec9160f5c3b1610a0408f2f80d567fcaa89, puppet-ceph could
manage it instead. This change passes the new rbd_default_features
parameter to puppet-ceph with a value of 15, the same value that this
module used to use for performance reasons.

Change-Id: I1810b0e58c47f3827b6396c039eb9a32510a7993
Depends-On: I477640c5db2cc84622da7734fb54cfe7740bd137

We should be extremely careful about adding more things into this and

commit_message:
Add debian-rootfs operating-system element

This is about the smallest element we can get for debian. The use
case, will be for people building containers with diskimage-builder.

We should be extremely careful about adding more things into this and
the debootstrap-minimal elements, chances are you need to be using the
debian-minimal or debootstrap elements.

Change-Id: I9a8ddddf20e0704ae1dd92354b28c7ab78af1a95
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-12 22:41:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/specs/v1/approved/dib-debootstrap-minimal-element.rst'], 'message': 'Add spec for debootstrap-minimal element

Expose the ability for a user to create a pristine debootstrap chroot
(image / tarball) using diskimage-builder. A pristine debootstrap
would only include packages installed by --variant=minbase flag.

Change-Id: If3bf2a558cdeeb3ca61d3b3cdd78dff3469ffc02
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add spec for debootstrap-minimal element

Expose the ability for a user to create a pristine debootstrap chroot
(image / tarball) using diskimage-builder. A pristine debootstrap
would only include packages installed by --variant=minbase flag.

Change-Id: If3bf2a558cdeeb3ca61d3b3cdd78dff3469ffc02
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Add support to task manager for async tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-01-16 21:38:43.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_adapter.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_task_manager.py', 'shade/task_manager.py'], 'message': "Add support to task manager for async tasks

In order to support replacing SwiftService, we need to be able to spin
some tasks into async threads. We'll allow for calculation of rate
limiting to match with the start of the call, but will return a Future
to the call site. This patch is followed by a patch to Nodepool to have
Nodepool's TaskManager subclass shade's TaskManager.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib473ceece7169d76dd37702d66b188a841ec3f59
"}]
commit_message:
Add support to task manager for async tasks

In order to support replacing SwiftService, we need to be able to spin
some tasks into async threads. We'll allow for calculation of rate
limiting to match with the start of the call, but will return a Future
to the call site. This patch is followed by a patch to Nodepool to have
Nodepool's TaskManager subclass shade's TaskManager.

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib473ceece7169d76dd37702d66b188a841ec3f59

commit_message:
Allow to attach/detach VIF to portgroup

With this patch port groups are activated in Ironic.
When attaching a VIF to a node, it is attached to the first
free port group. If there are no free port groups, the first
available port (pxe_enabled has higher priority) is used
instead.

Related-Bug: #1618754
Related-Bug: #1582188
Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok <vdrok@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I0dca2c2d98184e370c08c3e05aa3edadead869af

subject: [zmq] Dynamic connections failover
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-16 20:09:26.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/client/publishers/dealer/zmq_dealer_publisher_direct.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/client/publishers/dealer/zmq_dealer_publisher_proxy.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/zmq_options.py'], 'message': '[zmq] Dynamic connections failover

ZeroMQ manages failover automatically when socket is
being connected to multiple hosts. Dynamic connections
mode assumes to connect once per message so we connect
only to a single host. However we cannot say for sure
if this host is still alive. For failover reasons
we can connect to a primary host and then add some
more hosts as failover and let ZeroMQ to decide where
it finally sends the message.

Change-Id: I19cbb75aaea8a0b725dd6a8ff665392738e164a1
'}]
commit_message:
[zmq] Dynamic connections failover

ZeroMQ manages failover automatically when socket is
being connected to multiple hosts. Dynamic connections
mode assumes to connect once per message so we connect
only to a single host. However we cannot say for sure
if this host is still alive. For failover reasons
we can connect to a primary host and then add some
more hosts as failover and let ZeroMQ to decide where
it finally sends the message.

Change-Id: I19cbb75aaea8a0b725dd6a8ff665392738e164a1

commit_message:
Install epel-release before installing pkgs

Some packages, like `htop`, require that the `epel-release` package
(which configures the EPEL repository) is installed. This patch adds
a small task which installs that package before installing any other
host packages.

Closes-Bug: 1656901
Change-Id: I6c593ef5f019990447595c8a9951aaef505fb2af

commit_message:
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_BACKEND should be configurable

In local_settings.py.erb, OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_BACKEND is hardcoded.

We needed a new parameter in the module in order to change this to be
configurable.

Change-Id: I3f0859cd0e73012f444191797afc076beb68d7e9
Closes-Bug: #1575227
(cherry picked from commit 738584144285c103edc3bfbc8b992e827b2e451a)

commit_message:
Ensures that OneView nodes are free for use by Ironic

Following the requirement. The validation is used within
"OneViewPower.validate". As a result it enforces that a machine
is owned by OneView, thus it cannot be powered on or off by the
Ironic driver. Raising an exception when the node is owned by
Oneview.

Change-Id: Ibf500577b7a3b5976fd49fd217c1be3d3e9c0f46
Closes-Bug: 1627034
Co-Authored-By: Stenio Araujo <steniaraujo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

commit_message:
modernise gabbi usage

once upon a time, a boy named Gordon was bored and noticed a boy
named Chris added some new features to something called gabbi v1.7.
Gordon thought to himself that using the latest and greatest code
was best. he then began a quest to make things prettier by manually
searching because he was too inept to understand how to replace
effectively in vim.

Change-Id: I81e81c967a96d3a90462bd90126dff1005a1823f

subject: Fix cellsv2 cell0 database name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-15 17:45:13.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': "Fix cellsv2 cell0 database name

For some reason we were defaulting the name of the cell0 database
to nova_api_cell0 instead of nova_cell0. Devstack inherited that to
make things work, but we don't really want that. This patch makes us
use the proper name and create the cell0 mapping accordingly. As a
side effect, it also starts the process of unifying the cellsv1 and
cellsv2 paths by creating the cell0 mapping the same for both.

Change-Id: I4e7f6c5eaa068c98e5c4ef3feaee50d8e4f5d484
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cellsv2 cell0 database name

For some reason we were defaulting the name of the cell0 database
to nova_api_cell0 instead of nova_cell0. Devstack inherited that to
make things work, but we don't really want that. This patch makes us
use the proper name and create the cell0 mapping accordingly. As a
side effect, it also starts the process of unifying the cellsv1 and
cellsv2 paths by creating the cell0 mapping the same for both.

Change-Id: I4e7f6c5eaa068c98e5c4ef3feaee50d8e4f5d484

subject: Fix cellsv2 cell0 database name
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-15 21:55:12.000000000', 'files': ['projects/60_nova/from-newton/upgrade-nova', 'projects/60_nova/upgrade.sh', 'projects/60_nova/from-mitaka/upgrade-nova'], 'message': "Fix cellsv2 cell0 database name

For some reason we were defaulting the name of the cell0 database
to nova_api_cell0 instead of nova_cell0. Devstack inherited that to
make things work, but we don't really want that. This patch makes us
use the proper name and create the cell0 mapping accordingly. As a
side effect, it also starts the process of unifying the cellsv1 and
cellsv2 paths by creating the cell0 mapping the same for both.

This is the grenade side of I4e7f6c5eaa068c98e5c4ef3feaee50d8e4f5d484.

The related Nova change which depends on this is:

I86797785f76c2c927a4db8fef72b8f8d986af6b9

We have to change the from-update/upgrade-nova script to explicitly
call map_cell0 so we can control the database connection used to
workaround the bug being fixed in that Nova change.

Related-Bug: #1656673

Change-Id: Ifdcd6a572dc0b42ba852241e22f6713cd2b084b0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cellsv2 cell0 database name

For some reason we were defaulting the name of the cell0 database
to nova_api_cell0 instead of nova_cell0. Devstack inherited that to
make things work, but we don't really want that. This patch makes us
use the proper name and create the cell0 mapping accordingly. As a
side effect, it also starts the process of unifying the cellsv1 and
cellsv2 paths by creating the cell0 mapping the same for both.

This is the grenade side of I4e7f6c5eaa068c98e5c4ef3feaee50d8e4f5d484.

The related Nova change which depends on this is:

I86797785f76c2c927a4db8fef72b8f8d986af6b9

We have to change the from-update/upgrade-nova script to explicitly
call map_cell0 so we can control the database connection used to
workaround the bug being fixed in that Nova change.

Related-Bug: #1656673

Change-Id: Ifdcd6a572dc0b42ba852241e22f6713cd2b084b0

subject: Skip CI link in list for infra supported drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-06 19:55:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/generate_driver_list.py'], 'message': "Skip CI link in list for infra supported drivers

For lack of a better way, for drivers that have CI run by Jenkins we
denote this using the name 'Cinder_Jenkins'. CI links were added to
the generated driver list, but for these drivers this results in a
link to an invalid wiki page. For these drivers we should just skip
adding the CI info link.

Change-Id: I8a3087f8102392ca604a42fdf006e1a4e1a026d6
"}]
commit_message:
Skip CI link in list for infra supported drivers

For lack of a better way, for drivers that have CI run by Jenkins we
denote this using the name 'Cinder_Jenkins'. CI links were added to
the generated driver list, but for these drivers this results in a
link to an invalid wiki page. For these drivers we should just skip
adding the CI info link.

Change-Id: I8a3087f8102392ca604a42fdf006e1a4e1a026d6

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/1a71beefeaf13668ddd49d425aeb77be\n'

commit_message:
Allow clients to connect without ssl

Don't require (for now) the use of SSL/TLS on the connection. Once
all services are configured with cert settings for oslo.messaging
this could be re-enabled.

Change-Id: I1e61db2d4b60fbb7c05df051f7dd0bae52021fb9

subject: Add code to support novajoin in the undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-16 16:19:51.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'undercloud.conf.sample', 'instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/install.d/02-puppet-stack-config', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Add code to support novajoin in the undercloud

Novajoin is a new nova metadata micro-service that registers
instances created by nova with a FreeIPA server, so that we can
take advantage of server/service identities, kerberos credentials,
access and sudo controls etc.

The included modules will cause the undercloud to be registered with
a FreeIPA server, for novajoin to be installed, and for nova on the
undercloud to be configured to use novajoin.

Change-Id: I2e1c18a0174f70dc6e9c1d402caac574e6c81678
Implements: blueprint novajoin
'}]
commit_message:
Add code to support novajoin in the undercloud

Novajoin is a new nova metadata micro-service that registers
instances created by nova with a FreeIPA server, so that we can
take advantage of server/service identities, kerberos credentials,
access and sudo controls etc.

The included modules will cause the undercloud to be registered with
a FreeIPA server, for novajoin to be installed, and for nova on the
undercloud to be configured to use novajoin.

Change-Id: I2e1c18a0174f70dc6e9c1d402caac574e6c81678
Implements: blueprint novajoin

Let's disable Watcher until packages are built in RDO and dependencies
are fixed.

Change-Id: I321e7830aa3a94e23dac422470ba98a63a666fab
"}]
commit_message:
scenario004: disable watcher

Watcher introduced a new dependency with:
https://github.com/openstack/watcher/commit/a015af1bd2d672c7c0b68a3e617d7391fa889164

But RDO doesn't have any package for Monasca yet.
Let's disable Watcher until packages are built in RDO and dependencies
are fixed.

Change-Id: I321e7830aa3a94e23dac422470ba98a63a666fab

subject: Update shadow mapping spec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-16 15:12:14.000000000', 'files': ['specs/keystone/ocata/shadow-mapping.rst'], 'message': "Update shadow mapping spec

As we work through the implementation for auto-provisioning, it was
noted that we should update the spec to make sure it is consistent
with the implementation. We want to clarify that roles defined in the
shadow mapping aren't created on-the-fly, like other resources are.

This is due to the fact that policy changes might be required
across the deployment in order to use the role. This could still lead
to unfriendly user experience if a user is allow to authenticate,
gets a set of projects, then can't actually do anything with them
since the policy hasn't taken the new shadow role into consideration.

This is something that we could probably change in the future if we
find a way to work around the synchronization of policy and roles.

bp shadow-mapping

Change-Id: Ifc0a7191ec6717934564851f7b907ff815da7d2d
"}]
commit_message:
Update shadow mapping spec

As we work through the implementation for auto-provisioning, it was
noted that we should update the spec to make sure it is consistent
with the implementation. We want to clarify that roles defined in the
shadow mapping aren't created on-the-fly, like other resources are.

This is due to the fact that policy changes might be required
across the deployment in order to use the role. This could still lead
to unfriendly user experience if a user is allow to authenticate,
gets a set of projects, then can't actually do anything with them
since the policy hasn't taken the new shadow role into consideration.

This is something that we could probably change in the future if we
find a way to work around the synchronization of policy and roles.

bp shadow-mapping

Change-Id: Ifc0a7191ec6717934564851f7b907ff815da7d2d

Place nic-configs in the t-h-t path

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat-templates/+bug/1650625.
using the full path in the templates does not seem
workable as the temmplates path is configurable.
Moving the custom nic-configs to the t-h-t dir
so that the relative script path resolves.

psutil was capped in early 2014 for no particular reason, lets
see if we can uncap it since distributions in general like to
move to a newer version since amongst other things it provides

Change-Id: Ie3c33a6c1eddcca26ea5edd332a8292c006063a3

commit_message:
Remove upper cap for psutil

psutil was capped in early 2014 for no particular reason, lets
see if we can uncap it since distributions in general like to
move to a newer version since amongst other things it provides
a lot more fixes. Also bump minimum to the upper constraint since
thats likely our real lower bound meanwhile given that its
been at that value for more than two years.

Closes-Bug: 1645918
Depends-On: I6be775e83876271012f6b7a777ea2b5cc3a008f6
Change-Id: Ie3c33a6c1eddcca26ea5edd332a8292c006063a3

Enabling yum repos and installing the initial python-heat-agent package

Change-Id: I6be94604a46382e6288df1b36b9de8fab58696cc

commit_message:
Deployed server bootstrap via Heat

Adds an environment file, template, and script that can be used to do
initial bootstrapping of deployed servers during NodeExtraConfig. It is
meant to install and configure the initial dependencies needed to apply
the rest of the OpenStack configuration via Heat.

Enabling yum repos and installing the initial python-heat-agent package
would still have to be manual steps when using this environment. But the
goal is to keep those manual steps to a minimum and automate as much as
possible in deployed-server-bootstrap.sh.

Along with setting EnablePackageInstall: True, this could eventually
replace bootstrap-overcloud-full.sh from tripleo-ci.

Partially-implements: blueprint split-stack-software-configuration
Change-Id: I6be94604a46382e6288df1b36b9de8fab58696cc
