commit_message:
dib-lint: python3 compatibility fixes

When using up to date distributions for dib development, pep8
installs using python3.  This patch fixes the problem, that
not the complete dib-lint (which is called) is compatible
with python3.

Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Use source to run pre/post test hooks for heat

Right now any variables exported in pre_test_hook.sh and
post_test_hook.sh in heat's heat_integrationtests/ directory are
effectively lost. So unable to do simple thing like trying to
set DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT fails.

Change-Id: I8cea08d4171dbf0e0cde967c2fc90f8df842a201

subject: Add a constraint::order class
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-11 18:15:52.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/pcmk_constraint.rb', 'manifests/constraint/order.pp', 'lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_constraint/default.rb'], 'message': "Add a constraint::order class

In TripleO for the haproxy/vip ordering constraints we are still using
the deprecated constraint::base class. While both the location and
colocation constraint classes are already implemented via ruby and
leverage the common pcs() function, the constraint::base class does not.
Let's add a constraint::order class that mimics the same approach as the
colocation/location classes. This way underneath they will also use

Change-Id: I7bdda74a9cba51043677c3242b5a2142483dc7d8
"}]
commit_message:
Add a constraint::order class

In TripleO for the haproxy/vip ordering constraints we are still using
the deprecated constraint::base class. While both the location and
colocation constraint classes are already implemented via ruby and
leverage the common pcs() function, the constraint::base class does not.
Let's add a constraint::order class that mimics the same approach as the
colocation/location classes. This way underneath they will also use
the backup_cib()/push_cib() methods automatically and we will avoid
potential CIB push races.

Change-Id: I7bdda74a9cba51043677c3242b5a2142483dc7d8

commit_message:
Don't add xenial/trusty branch condition for periodic jobs

We have now periodic jobs that end with ubuntu-xenial or ubuntu-trusty -
and thuse will never run, since periodic jobs cannot have a branch
condition.

Change the global xenial/trusty branch condition to exclude periodic
jobs.

Change-Id: Ic836531e9490087311dd390778885783c379647b

subject: Do not operate on the live CIB with pcs commands
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-10 18:57:32.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb'], 'message': 'Do not operate on the live CIB with pcs commands

When doing composable HA we typically create different pacemaker
resources on the nodes that require it (i.e. not from a single node).

This is problematic due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1404233
The problem is that when node A creates resource foo and at the same
time node B creates resource bar, there is an potential race condition
because if both node A and B get a copy of the CIB at the same time,
the latter one to push the cib back (via pcs) will win and overwrite
the changes of the former one.

The most solid approach we discussed with the pcs team is twofold:
Use pacemaker's diff feature so that only a specific diff is sent on the
wire and not the whole CIB. This will make sure we avoid this race
because we never create overlapping resources from the same nodes. This
differential change requires that we do the following:
- Snapshot the CIB via "pcs cluster cib snapshot.xml"
- Make a copy of the CIB "cp snapshot.xml snapshot.xml.org"
- Make all changes via pcs -f snapshot.xml ....
- Push back the changes via an upcoming pcs command:
  pcs cluster cib-push snapshot.xml --diff=snapshot.xml.orig

This is all handled transparently by the backup_cib() and push_cib()
functions introduced earlier.

Change-Id: Id694585bb90c49f17e7a43f3ae555c6bd94945cb
'}]
commit_message:
Do not operate on the live CIB with pcs commands

When doing composable HA we typically create different pacemaker
resources on the nodes that require it (i.e. not from a single node).

This is problematic due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1404233
The problem is that when node A creates resource foo and at the same
time node B creates resource bar, there is an potential race condition
because if both node A and B get a copy of the CIB at the same time,
the latter one to push the cib back (via pcs) will win and overwrite
the changes of the former one.

The most solid approach we discussed with the pcs team is twofold:
Use pacemaker's diff feature so that only a specific diff is sent on the
wire and not the whole CIB. This will make sure we avoid this race
because we never create overlapping resources from the same nodes. This
differential change requires that we do the following:
- Snapshot the CIB via "pcs cluster cib snapshot.xml"
- Make a copy of the CIB "cp snapshot.xml snapshot.xml.org"
- Make all changes via pcs -f snapshot.xml ....
- Push back the changes via an upcoming pcs command:
  pcs cluster cib-push snapshot.xml --diff=snapshot.xml.orig

This is all handled transparently by the backup_cib() and push_cib()
functions introduced earlier.

Change-Id: Id694585bb90c49f17e7a43f3ae555c6bd94945cb

Currently cluster properties are simply implemented with a few

Change-Id: I9cff31b903e9f2ff6d1a81da99cabea6a7c8b639
'}]
commit_message:
Move cluster properties implementation to ruby

Currently cluster properties are simply implemented with a few
pcs Exec calls. Reimplement this functionality in ruby so that
we can leverage the newly introduced common pcs() functions.

This move also makes the code a bit simpler as it is cleaner to
write the code to deal with the following pcs bug:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1302010.

Change-Id: I9cff31b903e9f2ff6d1a81da99cabea6a7c8b639

subject: Move all pcs() function to a common file for increased re-use
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-10 18:57:32.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_constraint/default.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_resource/default.rb'], 'message': "Move all pcs() function to a common file for increased re-use

Currently both pcmk_constraint and pcmk_resource implement a generic
pcs() function that is used by each class. Let's move the more generic
one from pcmk_resource to a common include file (pcmk_common) and make
both classes reuse the pcs() function.

Change-Id: Ieb367c6da7113a3b3758f4dd85678577d350af7a
"}]
commit_message:
Move all pcs() function to a common file for increased re-use

Currently both pcmk_constraint and pcmk_resource implement a generic
pcs() function that is used by each class. Let's move the more generic
one from pcmk_resource to a common include file (pcmk_common) and make
both classes reuse the pcs() function.

Change-Id: Ieb367c6da7113a3b3758f4dd85678577d350af7a

subject: Add a pcmk_common file with some helper routines
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-10 18:57:32.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb'], 'message': 'Add a pcmk_common file with some helper routines

In this change we add a common lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb
file that will contain any function or routine that can be reused
across the different providers.

With this initial commit we add two routines that we will later make
use of:
- backup_cib() which takes a snapshot of the current live cluster CIB
  and stores it in a temporary file under /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/ and
  also makes a copy of it right away
- push_cib() takes a CIB file and pushes the CIB. If the pcs version
  supports it, it will use the "diff-against" syntax, which means that
  only the diff between the CIB file and the copy of the file made via
  backup_cib() will be sent to the cluster for processing.
  If the cib file and its original copy counterpart have no differences
  push_cib() is a noop

Change-Id: Icac6aac458031f5c0a08aac5f134976cf737e696
'}]
commit_message:
Add a pcmk_common file with some helper routines

In this change we add a common lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_common.rb
file that will contain any function or routine that can be reused
across the different providers.

With this initial commit we add two routines that we will later make
use of:
- backup_cib() which takes a snapshot of the current live cluster CIB
  and stores it in a temporary file under /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/ and
  also makes a copy of it right away
- push_cib() takes a CIB file and pushes the CIB. If the pcs version
  supports it, it will use the "diff-against" syntax, which means that
  only the diff between the CIB file and the copy of the file made via
  backup_cib() will be sent to the cluster for processing.
  If the cib file and its original copy counterpart have no differences
  push_cib() is a noop

Change-Id: Icac6aac458031f5c0a08aac5f134976cf737e696

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 11047, 'name': 'Mark Sturdevant', 'email': 'mark.sturdevant@ibm.com', 'username': 'markstur'}, {'_account_id': 11865, 'name': 'Clinton Knight', 'email': 'cknight@netapp.com', 'username': 'cknight'}, {'_account_id': 14567, 'name': 'Rodrigo Barbieri', 'email': 'rodrigo.barbieri@canonical.com', 'username': 'ganso'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 23083, 'name': 'TommyLike', 'email': 'tommylikehu@gmail.com', 'username': 'TommyLike'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-01-16 17:12:14.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_share_networks.py', 'manilaclient/v2/shell.py', 'manilaclient/v2/share_networks.py', 'manilaclient/tests/functional/base.py', 'manilaclient/tests/unit/v2/fake_clients.py', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-nova-net-id-option-for-share-nets-82e424b75221528b.yaml', 'manilaclient/tests/functional/test_share_networks.py', 'manilaclient/api_versions.py'], 'message': 'Remove Nova Net option for share networks

Nova network was deprecated in Newton and is no longer supported for
regular deployments in Ocata [1].  In manila itself, changes [2] and
[3] remove nova network plugin support in manila services and remove
the nova-network-id field from the database model for share networks.

Add a new micro-version in which nova-network-id options are no longer
allowed when creating or modifying share networks.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/unreleased.html
[2] I846b760fa7c01f7f86768399a2bfad9ced7e57cd
[3] I8b9a559fbea61979f01737ed1dc272276c4f1269

Partially-implements: bp remove-nova-net-plugin

Closes-Bug: #1656756

Change-Id: Ic27b7d26a5a7d1100e57ee8a857fc45fc3b0a909
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Nova Net option for share networks

Nova network was deprecated in Newton and is no longer supported for
regular deployments in Ocata [1].  In manila itself, changes [2] and
[3] remove nova network plugin support in manila services and remove
the nova-network-id field from the database model for share networks.

Add a new micro-version in which nova-network-id options are no longer
allowed when creating or modifying share networks.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/unreleased.html
[2] I846b760fa7c01f7f86768399a2bfad9ced7e57cd
[3] I8b9a559fbea61979f01737ed1dc272276c4f1269

Partially-implements: bp remove-nova-net-plugin

Closes-Bug: #1656756

Change-Id: Ic27b7d26a5a7d1100e57ee8a857fc45fc3b0a909

commit_message:
[gate-quickstart] Workaround for ansible bug 5504

Our gates in ci.centos currently fail when using depends-on in
both the extras->quickstart and quickstart->extras directions.

This patch addresses the extras->quickstart direction by
adding a workaround for a bug in the ansible git module when
using "force"

Change-Id: I5e74377081ff1c4644da5930a496078a5b422692
Closes-Bug: 1655757

commit_message:
Break neutron endpoints job up further

This lets you run each job one at a time. It uses templates to do
it so it isn't much more code. This is a step towards being able
to move most of the bootstrap jobs into services/common too as there
is a lot of common code between the services.

Change-Id: Icec23ea533835808bcf5b4b39e26c0ab98f7216a

Only a few Cinder backends support the 'manage snapshot' feature. So
we need a feature flag here. Luckily the LVM driver does support this
feature so default the feature flag to True in devstack(/Gate) but
introduce a variable to tweak the config.

Change-Id: Ifcb9f91059f08bdf2faf2a8d65229aba5742ee1c
Depends-On: I77be1cf85a946bf72e852f6378f0d7b43af8023a

commit_message:
lib/tempest: allow tweaking volume-feature-enabled/manage_snapshot

Only a few Cinder backends support the 'manage snapshot' feature. So
we need a feature flag here. Luckily the LVM driver does support this
feature so default the feature flag to True in devstack(/Gate) but
introduce a variable to tweak the config.

Change-Id: Ifcb9f91059f08bdf2faf2a8d65229aba5742ee1c
Depends-On: I77be1cf85a946bf72e852f6378f0d7b43af8023a

subject: Update and clean up run_tests.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-06 16:55:39.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I68373ad89a165ad708851242f7ff8bb1518085df
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
'}]
commit_message:
Update and clean up run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script fails when it is run multiple times on CentOS.
The `bindep` run returns an empty list of packages and then `yum`
exits with an error since no packages were provided to install.

This patch checks the length of the `bindep` output and skips the `yum`
installation when the package list is empty.

The patch also cleans up some of the old cruft left over from previous
scripts and avoids repetition.

Change-Id: I68373ad89a165ad708851242f7ff8bb1518085df
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

commit_message:
devstack: check latest revision of ODL snapshot

Get latest revision number from given ODL major.minor snapshot version
by checking ODL nexus maven meta data.
Thus we don't have to maintain ODL latest snapshot versions.

Change-Id: I9fac8ff319c9ec47acf06ce3c520c4388b042ef7

commit_message:
Add an IronicAutomatedCleaning parameter

Ironic cleaning can be safely disabled in a single tenant environment.
It saves significant time when deleting nodes in my dev environment
and would likely benefit others as well.

Change-Id: If6fb01101ee0b1d780adc1f8af7c69281ef2bf94

commit_message:
Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

The constants of log levels were added in the 1.8 version of
the oslo.log library. So we can replace all usage of system
logging module with log module from oslo.log.

Change-Id: Ide50502f020eb1309648f4f9fc8a9c17aa1a1d9c

commit_message:
Adding mysqld_safe back to OCF script.

- mysqld_safe helped to restart mysqld thus the convergence of cluster
  was a few times faster
- Added logging for more convinient debugging

Closes-Bug: #1652008

Change-Id: I6ee1bf451f7c954aeb7a2974bb980054422454b8
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

This change adds a new attribute - physical_disks - to
dracclient.resources.raid.VirtualDisk objects. The attribute is a
list of IDs of the physical disks that a virtual disk is composed of.
This allows clients of the library to obtain a more complete view of

Closes-bug: #1651702

commit_message:
Add constituent physical disks to RAID virtual disk object

This change adds a new attribute - physical_disks - to
dracclient.resources.raid.VirtualDisk objects. The attribute is a
list of IDs of the physical disks that a virtual disk is composed of.
This allows clients of the library to obtain a more complete view of
the current RAID configuration.

Change-Id: If4f762d3bc115a971d0392af8270f5440ef43913
Closes-bug: #1651702

subject: Remove "baremetal show capabilities" command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 08:12:13.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/baremetal/test_baremetal.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/baremetal.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Remove "baremetal show capabilities" command

It has been in conflict with "baremetal show" command provided by Ironic
since Mitaka, and due to that has been completely broken. The only
reason we haven't noticed that is because nobody uses this command.
Let's just remove it.

Change-Id: I645536f0ae0af3bd318db26543a662de659a27a5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "baremetal show capabilities" command

It has been in conflict with "baremetal show" command provided by Ironic
since Mitaka, and due to that has been completely broken. The only
reason we haven't noticed that is because nobody uses this command.
Let's just remove it.

Change-Id: I645536f0ae0af3bd318db26543a662de659a27a5

commit_message:
Stop Ceilometer API testing

Ceilometer API is deprecated; use APIs from Aodh (alarms), Gnocchi
(metrics) and/or Panko (events).
Since we already deploy Aodh, Gnocchi and Panko for centos7 CI jobs,
stop testing Ceilometer API.

commit_message:
Include ::heat at step 3

Since we include ::heat::keystone::domain at step 3, and that class
requires heat.conf since it uses the heat_config resource, we need to
also include ::heat at step 3. The ::heat class will take care of
installing openstack-heat-common that provides heat.conf.

Closes-Bug: #165389
Partially-implements: blueprint split-stack-software-configuration
Change-Id: I5ba34ca96ca84d3f1cf3785ed8bbef6720f7bd42

subject: Move not provisioned nodes to error status
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-16 12:12:40.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/provision.rb', 'spec/unit/provision_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Move not provisioned nodes to error status

When there are lot of nodes to provision and we provision
them by chunks, we could fail in the middle due to "Too many
nodes failed to provision". If so, we need to append those
nodes where we did not started provision at all to the list
of failed nodes. Otherwise, those nodes will be reported
as 'provisioned' with progress = 100 and rebooted.
But for some reasons we bind all nodes before starting provision
to debian-installer profile in cobbler, and being rebooted
these not provisioned nodes will fail to boot, because since
7.0 we put empty files where cobbler expects debian-installer
kernel and initrd files. :-)

Change-Id: I2a401b80614ee7dd5a10931b9b50bcff066f790f
Closes-Bug: #1656269
(cherry picked from commit 570049ca1fde98ee09952075f72bc4f28b9d8b71)
'}]
commit_message:
Move not provisioned nodes to error status

When there are lot of nodes to provision and we provision
them by chunks, we could fail in the middle due to "Too many
nodes failed to provision". If so, we need to append those
nodes where we did not started provision at all to the list
of failed nodes. Otherwise, those nodes will be reported
as 'provisioned' with progress = 100 and rebooted.
But for some reasons we bind all nodes before starting provision
to debian-installer profile in cobbler, and being rebooted
these not provisioned nodes will fail to boot, because since
7.0 we put empty files where cobbler expects debian-installer
kernel and initrd files. :-)

Change-Id: I2a401b80614ee7dd5a10931b9b50bcff066f790f
Closes-Bug: #1656269
(cherry picked from commit 570049ca1fde98ee09952075f72bc4f28b9d8b71)

subject: Move documented reclaim_age option to correct location
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 12261, 'name': 'Mahati', 'email': 'mahati.chamarthy@gmail.com', 'username': 'Mahati'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2017-01-13 03:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deployment_guide.rst', 'swift/obj/reconstructor.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'doc/manpages/object-server.conf.5', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/expirer.py', 'etc/object-server.conf-sample', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py', 'swift/obj/replicator.py', 'swift/container/reconciler.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': "Move documented reclaim_age option to correct location

The reclaim_age is a DiskFile option, it doesn't make sense for two
different object services or nodes to use different values.

I also driveby cleanup the reclaim_age plumbing from get_hashes to
cleanup_ondisk_files since it's a method on the Manager and has access
to the configured reclaim_age.  This fixes a bug where finalize_put
wouldn't use the [DEFAULT]/object-server configured reclaim_age - which
is normally benign but leads to weird behavior on DELETE requests with
really small reclaim_age.

There's a couple of places in the replicator and reconstructor that
reach into their manager to borrow the reclaim_age when emptying out
the aborted PUTs that failed to cleanup their files in tmp - but that
timeout doesn't really need to be coupled with reclaim_age and that
method could have just as reasonably been implemented on the Manager.

UpgradeImpact: Previously the reclaim_age was documented to be
configurable in various object-* services config sections, but that did
not work correctly unless you also configured the option for the
object-server because of REPLICATE request rehash cleanup.  All object
services must use the same reclaim_age.  If you require a non-default
reclaim age it should be set in the [DEFAULT] section.  If there are
different non-default values, the greater should be used for all object
services and configured only in the [DEFAULT] section.

If you specify a reclaim_age value in any object related config you
should move it to *only* the [DEFAULT] section before you upgrade.  If
you configure a reclaim_age less that your consistency window you are
likely to be eaten by a Grue.

Closes-Bug: #1626296

Change-Id: I2b9189941ac29f6e3be69f76ff1c416315270916
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Move documented reclaim_age option to correct location

The reclaim_age is a DiskFile option, it doesn't make sense for two
different object services or nodes to use different values.

I also driveby cleanup the reclaim_age plumbing from get_hashes to
cleanup_ondisk_files since it's a method on the Manager and has access
to the configured reclaim_age.  This fixes a bug where finalize_put
wouldn't use the [DEFAULT]/object-server configured reclaim_age - which
is normally benign but leads to weird behavior on DELETE requests with
really small reclaim_age.

There's a couple of places in the replicator and reconstructor that
reach into their manager to borrow the reclaim_age when emptying out
the aborted PUTs that failed to cleanup their files in tmp - but that
timeout doesn't really need to be coupled with reclaim_age and that
method could have just as reasonably been implemented on the Manager.

UpgradeImpact: Previously the reclaim_age was documented to be
configurable in various object-* services config sections, but that did
not work correctly unless you also configured the option for the
object-server because of REPLICATE request rehash cleanup.  All object
services must use the same reclaim_age.  If you require a non-default
reclaim age it should be set in the [DEFAULT] section.  If there are
different non-default values, the greater should be used for all object
services and configured only in the [DEFAULT] section.

If you specify a reclaim_age value in any object related config you
should move it to *only* the [DEFAULT] section before you upgrade.  If
you configure a reclaim_age less that your consistency window you are
likely to be eaten by a Grue.

Closes-Bug: #1626296

Change-Id: I2b9189941ac29f6e3be69f76ff1c416315270916
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Make the log work when deploy Zaqar with uwsgi

The zaqar-wsgi runs under uwsgi by devstack can't
print any WARNING, DEBUG, ERROR or INFO log now.

This path add the log initialization for uwsgi boot.

Change-Id: Ifcd6be908442275d2acbde2562e593b2ca87b277
Cloese-bug: #1645492

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-13 10:20:08.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/deploy.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_pxe.py', 'releasenotes/notes/check-for-whole-disk-image-uefi-3bf2146588de2423.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ilo/test_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Remove check for UEFI + Whole disk images

This patch is removing a conditional preventing whole disk images from
being deployed in UEFI mode without local boot.

This conditional is an inconsistency because whole disk images being
deployed in non-UEFI mode don't need to explicitly set the boot_option
from "local", also, in Ironic when deploying a whole disk image we
already assume local boot by default.

Change-Id: I678e3547397eac3199d8ff670fe281e20b2cd2c0
Closes-Bug: #1627022
'}]
commit_message:
Remove check for UEFI + Whole disk images

This patch is removing a conditional preventing whole disk images from
being deployed in UEFI mode without local boot.

This conditional is an inconsistency because whole disk images being
deployed in non-UEFI mode don't need to explicitly set the boot_option
from "local", also, in Ironic when deploying a whole disk image we
already assume local boot by default.

Change-Id: I678e3547397eac3199d8ff670fe281e20b2cd2c0
Closes-Bug: #1627022

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-16 07:38:09.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/v1/create_resources.py'], 'message': 'Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace all occurrences
with yaml.safe_load().

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I6db250c03b8a9ca1942e1809831190b0e10423a5
Closes-Bug: #1634265
'}]
commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace all occurrences
with yaml.safe_load().

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I6db250c03b8a9ca1942e1809831190b0e10423a5
Closes-Bug: #1634265

subject: [Doc] Update quickstart Guide: Using a Kubernetes Cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-16 13:43:46.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/quickstart.rst'], 'message': '[Doc] Update quickstart Guide: Using a Kubernetes Cluster

Instead of downloading kubernetes.tar.xz for extracting "kubectl"
binary, we should download only kubectl binary(v1.2.0) for accessing
kubernetes cluster.

Reason for this change: The tar archive is of
large size(above 100MB for v1.0.1 and above 400MB for v1.2.0) which
is not required.

Closes-Bug: #1656752
Change-Id: I6c0013c6900252486129a9ba0e7d9df23d577d77
'}]
commit_message:
[Doc] Update quickstart Guide: Using a Kubernetes Cluster

Instead of downloading kubernetes.tar.xz for extracting "kubectl"
binary, we should download only kubectl binary(v1.2.0) for accessing
kubernetes cluster.

Reason for this change: The tar archive is of
large size(above 100MB for v1.0.1 and above 400MB for v1.2.0) which
is not required.

Closes-Bug: #1656752
Change-Id: I6c0013c6900252486129a9ba0e7d9df23d577d77

subject: Don't assume 'dhcp' if node_network_data set
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 16:24:50.000000000', 'files': ['bifrost/inventory.py'], 'message': "Don't assume 'dhcp' if node_network_data set

If ipv4_address is not set, the current logic in inventory.py sets the
addressing_mode to dhcp which prevents network_data.json being
generated. This means that even if node_network_data is set which
overrides ipv4_address, you have to set it anyway to ensure that your
node_network_data gets written to the file. This patch fixes the logic
such that only if both of ipv4_address and node_network_data are not
set, then it assumes addressing_mode=dhcp.

Change-Id: Iab8e0a8422d9f33c8c5b1362bdaefabf6f39d52e
Closes-Bug: #1656335
"}]
commit_message:
Don't assume 'dhcp' if node_network_data set

If ipv4_address is not set, the current logic in inventory.py sets the
addressing_mode to dhcp which prevents network_data.json being
generated. This means that even if node_network_data is set which
overrides ipv4_address, you have to set it anyway to ensure that your
node_network_data gets written to the file. This patch fixes the logic
such that only if both of ipv4_address and node_network_data are not
set, then it assumes addressing_mode=dhcp.

Change-Id: Iab8e0a8422d9f33c8c5b1362bdaefabf6f39d52e
Closes-Bug: #1656335

subject: Remove Aptira's feed during election times
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-10 23:27:35.000000000', 'files': ['planet.ini'], 'message': "Remove Aptira's feed during election times

Again at election time, Aptira's feed gets filled with ads for one
of their employees, who is candidate as Individual Member for BoD.
While one post would be acceptable (like many individual candidates
do) a continued series of posts makes planet less useful during
elections times.

Also, it's bad form for a company to heavily sponsor the election of
an Individual member: these seats should be elected as individual and
not because of their affiliation to a company.

Change-Id: I03f0bcfc19badb3e8c760b8d2a1d4d5df666adeb
"}]
commit_message:
Remove Aptira's feed during election times

Again at election time, Aptira's feed gets filled with ads for one
of their employees, who is candidate as Individual Member for BoD.
While one post would be acceptable (like many individual candidates
do) a continued series of posts makes planet less useful during
elections times.

Also, it's bad form for a company to heavily sponsor the election of
an Individual member: these seats should be elected as individual and
not because of their affiliation to a company.

Change-Id: I03f0bcfc19badb3e8c760b8d2a1d4d5df666adeb

commit_message:
Fix SSL/TLS verification for network commands

The network commands ignored the --insecure and --os-cacert
options and OS_CACERT environment variable which prevented
them from properly completing SSL/TLS verification. This
resulted in the network commands failing with
"An SSL error occurred."

Change-Id: I15167631ef58335e1476c16b828b079e3b0f13c1
Closes-Bug: #1560157
(cherry picked from commit b5f10f43eb9fd1a046a3e80db09d8bc8c350c218)

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-12-29 15:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/static/dashboard/developer/profiler/profiler.controller.js', 'openstack_dashboard/templates/horizon/_scripts.html', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/profiler/middleware.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/static/dashboard/developer/profiler/profiler.module.js', 'openstack_dashboard/context_processors.py', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/static/dashboard/developer/profiler/profiler.tree-node.html', 'openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/profiler/api.py'], 'message': 'Enable profiling of angular pages (with async requests)

The main difficulty in tracing async requests which are made during
the rendering of Angular-based pages is tracking the root request (the
one which was made to render the skeleton page which then initiated
all other requests) throughout other requests, so they form a cohesive
trace. This is solved by capturing the root request id and exposing it
as a profiler module constant in the process of interpolating
_scripts.html Django template. Then if that constant is not an empty
dictionary, profiler module intercepts all Angular requests and adds
osprofiler headers to them.

This patch also fixes issues which arose after transitioning to the
new version of angular-bootstrap.

Change-Id: I656028b969289a473f54594681d9313ff8a07fd8
'}]
commit_message:
Enable profiling of angular pages (with async requests)

The main difficulty in tracing async requests which are made during
the rendering of Angular-based pages is tracking the root request (the
one which was made to render the skeleton page which then initiated
all other requests) throughout other requests, so they form a cohesive
trace. This is solved by capturing the root request id and exposing it
as a profiler module constant in the process of interpolating
_scripts.html Django template. Then if that constant is not an empty
dictionary, profiler module intercepts all Angular requests and adds
osprofiler headers to them.

This patch also fixes issues which arose after transitioning to the
new version of angular-bootstrap.

Change-Id: I656028b969289a473f54594681d9313ff8a07fd8

subject: Fix apt-cacher-ng file owners during rsync
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 10881, 'name': 'Neill Cox', 'email': 'neill@ingenious.com.au', 'username': 'neillc'}, {'_account_id': 14806, 'name': 'Chhavi Agarwal', 'email': 'chhagarw@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'chhagarw'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22111, 'name': 'Ravi Gummadi', 'email': 'ravigumm@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'ravigumm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-20 00:54:45.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/repo_post_install.yml', 'templates/acng.conf.j2', 'templates/repo_prepost_cmd.sh.j2', 'templates/lsyncd.lua.j2', 'tasks/repo_cacher.yml', 'tasks/repo_pre_install.yml', 'templates/git.service.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Fix apt-cacher-ng file owners during rsync

The lsyncd service runs as the 'nginx' user such that files sync'd
from the master node to the backups will have 'nginx' as the owner.
However, the apt-cacher-ng service needs to be the owner to function
properly. This fix consolidates the pre and post sync tasks into
a script that can be called by lsyncd. The script can then change
the file owners as needed before and after the rsync.  The owners
need to be 'nginx' before the rsync so that lsyncd can update
files and 'apt-cacher-ng' after the sync so the cacher service works.

Additionally, setup lsyncd to sync each service's directory separately
rather than being rsync'd all together. This avoids lsyncd bouncing
services when their respective files are not being sync'd.

Change-Id: Ifaba17b89035398917f2b3257574e18eb9027c08
Closes-bug: #1649339
"}]
commit_message:
Fix apt-cacher-ng file owners during rsync

The lsyncd service runs as the 'nginx' user such that files sync'd
from the master node to the backups will have 'nginx' as the owner.
However, the apt-cacher-ng service needs to be the owner to function
properly. This fix consolidates the pre and post sync tasks into
a script that can be called by lsyncd. The script can then change
the file owners as needed before and after the rsync.  The owners
need to be 'nginx' before the rsync so that lsyncd can update
files and 'apt-cacher-ng' after the sync so the cacher service works.

Additionally, setup lsyncd to sync each service's directory separately
rather than being rsync'd all together. This avoids lsyncd bouncing
services when their respective files are not being sync'd.

Change-Id: Ifaba17b89035398917f2b3257574e18eb9027c08
Closes-bug: #1649339

subject: Fix nova-compute charm with libvirt UCA
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-10 15:22:14.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/nova_compute_context.py', 'unit_tests/test_nova_compute_contexts.py'], 'message': "Fix nova-compute charm with libvirt UCA

The UCA cloud archive recently added a newer version of
libvirt, however the daemon was not running after the charm
had finished installing. This was due to the fact that
the 'libvirtd' user was being selected based on the
Ubuntu release and not the openstack release.

Detect the openstack release as well that we are using
so we configure the libvirtd.conf properly.

Change-Id: Iffa2a00f12a252bd9eea76dde6f262779bc67158
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-compute charm with libvirt UCA

The UCA cloud archive recently added a newer version of
libvirt, however the daemon was not running after the charm
had finished installing. This was due to the fact that
the 'libvirtd' user was being selected based on the
Ubuntu release and not the openstack release.

Detect the openstack release as well that we are using
so we configure the libvirtd.conf properly.

Change-Id: Iffa2a00f12a252bd9eea76dde6f262779bc67158
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Limit cluster task cross-dependency on primary-cluster

Cluster task should cross-depend on primary-cluster only if current
node has primary-something role. Otherwise a loop listed in the
referenced bug occurs and deployment breaks.

Also, that CR makes change in rabbitmq networking trigger OpenStack
tasks. That fixes the old assumption that RabbitMQ always lives on
controllers. Now changes in networking of nodes with RabbitMQ role
will also trigger modification of configs for OpenStack services on
other nodes, updating rabbit_hosts parameter.

For the same reason (changes in rabbitmq should trigger OpenStack
tasks) all OpenStack tasks now cross-depend on rabbitmq.

Finally the CR fixes typo in openstack-cinder/tasks.yaml:
cross-depened-by -> cross-dependend-by

Closes-Bug: #1651066

Change-Id: I8b262ef73c9c62ce5a71f0a5eee001b61ba9ecb1

subject: Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-16 08:36:29.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_betamax_serializer.py'], 'message': 'Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ia45006ce1382022e5c776d06fdc3c33e9b4d8c47
Closes-Bug: #1634265
'}]
commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ia45006ce1382022e5c776d06fdc3c33e9b4d8c47
Closes-Bug: #1634265

node has primary-something role. Otherwise a loop listed in the
referenced bug occurs and deployment breaks.

tasks. That fixes the old assumption that RabbitMQ always lives on
controllers. Now changes in networking of nodes with RabbitMQ role
will also trigger modification of configs for OpenStack services on
other nodes, updating rabbit_hosts parameter.

tasks) all OpenStack tasks now cross-depend on rabbitmq.

Finally the CR fixes typo in openstack-cinder/tasks.yaml:
cross-depened-by -> cross-dependend-by

subject: Upgrade shrinkwrap format from npm2 to npm3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 18:04:34.000000000', 'files': ['npm-shrinkwrap.json'], 'message': 'Upgrade shrinkwrap format from npm2 to npm3

This is what I did (with npm 3.10.x):

* rm npm-shrinkwrap.json
* rm -rf node_modules
* npm cache clean
* npm install
* npm shrinkwrap

npm3 shrinkwrap is idempotent so going forward diff sizes of the
npm-shrinkwrap file should be a lot smaller.

Change-Id: If43e2adb9a21bb31cdb94e13446b0ab13c4b710b
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade shrinkwrap format from npm2 to npm3

This is what I did (with npm 3.10.x):

* rm npm-shrinkwrap.json
* rm -rf node_modules
* npm cache clean
* npm install
* npm shrinkwrap

npm3 shrinkwrap is idempotent so going forward diff sizes of the
npm-shrinkwrap file should be a lot smaller.

Change-Id: If43e2adb9a21bb31cdb94e13446b0ab13c4b710b

The ActionTestsV2.test_get_list_actions_greater_than_filter test will

Change-Id: I0bf6cadac9c3f01681e603b9c77c55ba87029dbd

commit_message:
Use utcnow() instead of now()

The ActionTestsV2.test_get_list_actions_greater_than_filter test will
fail if the system running the tests has a TZ that is behind UTC. By
using utcnow(), it will compare the times correctly.

Change-Id: I0bf6cadac9c3f01681e603b9c77c55ba87029dbd

subject: Fixes out of order deployment logs in environment details page.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-08 18:16:43.000000000', 'files': ['murano/api/v1/deployments.py'], 'message': 'Fixes out of order deployment logs in environment details page.

Deployment logs may sometimes appear out of order, when
deployment tasks execute very quickly, such that a task
is saved almost at the same time as the final deployment task --
i.e. when "Deployment finished" or "Deletion finished" is stored
in the DB.

Right now, the deployment task select query only orders by
created time -- but when the last task is created at the same time
as another task, the ordering is wrong in murano dashboard.

This patch adds an additional order_by to statuses in
murano.api.v1.deployments.

Change-Id: I13ff3fe33bdbaa547043e20e8f5c8e09734b16ab
Closes-Bug: #1654877
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes out of order deployment logs in environment details page.

Deployment logs may sometimes appear out of order, when
deployment tasks execute very quickly, such that a task
is saved almost at the same time as the final deployment task --
i.e. when "Deployment finished" or "Deletion finished" is stored
in the DB.

Right now, the deployment task select query only orders by
created time -- but when the last task is created at the same time
as another task, the ordering is wrong in murano dashboard.

This patch adds an additional order_by to statuses in
murano.api.v1.deployments.

Change-Id: I13ff3fe33bdbaa547043e20e8f5c8e09734b16ab
Closes-Bug: #1654877

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 13:09:43.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ceph'], 'message': 'Fix disk size default settings

In [1] the default value for CEPH_LOOPBACK_DISK_SIZE_DEFAULT was changed
to be VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE instead of a fixed value. This will break
in some cases as there is no fallback defined for
VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE in devstack/lib/ceph.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/403988

Change-Id: I117e36db442c8ef8c469e4149629e8a27d22da22
'}]
commit_message:
Fix disk size default settings

In [1] the default value for CEPH_LOOPBACK_DISK_SIZE_DEFAULT was changed
to be VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE instead of a fixed value. This will break
in some cases as there is no fallback defined for
VOLUME_BACKING_FILE_SIZE in devstack/lib/ceph.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/403988

Change-Id: I117e36db442c8ef8c469e4149629e8a27d22da22

commit_message:
TLS loadbalancer creation fails due to unread neutron_lbaas.conf

LBaaS v2 agent is starting without the config file neutron_lbaas.conf.
Added the file to lbaas' container config directory in order to
initialize a Keystone session for the creation of a TLS listener.

Change-Id: I2f47590af0421f4c8f1c8fd25e599e446ad1c0f1
Closes-Bug: #1656777

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-16 12:02:57.000000000', 'files': ['tools/zanata/zanata_users.py'], 'message': 'Zanata member list update tool

Unfortunately current Zanata 3.7.3 does not support
member list API. This tool is developed to retrieve member
list in Zanata and save the list into yaml based format.
The output file name is translation_team.yaml by default,
and the name can be changed using -o option.

Note that this tool uses BeautifulSoap4 and requests
libraries.

Change-Id: Iaf3d845514e85f8c160efdf6c10afeaaf8077857
Co-Authored-By: Ian Y. Choi <ianyrchoi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Zanata member list update tool

Unfortunately current Zanata 3.7.3 does not support
member list API. This tool is developed to retrieve member
list in Zanata and save the list into yaml based format.
The output file name is translation_team.yaml by default,
and the name can be changed using -o option.

Note that this tool uses BeautifulSoap4 and requests
libraries.

Change-Id: Iaf3d845514e85f8c160efdf6c10afeaaf8077857
Co-Authored-By: Ian Y. Choi <ianyrchoi@gmail.com>

subject: Clean up developer mode logic
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-16 12:55:31.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Clean up developer mode logic

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Additional cleanup to the developer_mode venv deployment
logic is implemented by adding a *_venv_download var
which is used to decouple developer_mode from the
cached venv extraction process so that a deployer
can force venv builds in-place (disable cached
venv usage) without enabling developer mode
constraints.

Change-Id: I0280dce05e9f20b035e64b85750c72895e83a4b7
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up developer mode logic

Fixes the ability to deploy a venv in cases where:
1) developer_mode is not enabled
2) A cached venv is not downloaded from the repo server

Additional cleanup to the developer_mode venv deployment
logic is implemented by adding a *_venv_download var
which is used to decouple developer_mode from the
cached venv extraction process so that a deployer
can force venv builds in-place (disable cached
venv usage) without enabling developer mode
constraints.

Change-Id: I0280dce05e9f20b035e64b85750c72895e83a4b7

ARA [1] records ansible-playbook runs.

commit_message:
Add the ARA Ansible callback generate a static playbook reports

ARA [1] records ansible-playbook runs.
It provides a CLI and web interface to browse detailed and organized
information about the results of those playbook runs.

This commit makes it so ARA is installed and set up as a callback
and then generates a static report that can later be picked up
by the collect-logs role.

[1]: http://ara.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq.html#what-is-ara

Change-Id: If65bbd0259229c0db684ea628814f90d8cde12e8

subject: Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-16 09:17:24.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/manager.py'], 'message': 'Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I4aac907c2a7ecf9a3f85a1a07ca020df6eb0b756
Closes-Bug: #1634265
'}]
commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Avoid dangerous file parsing and object serialization libraries.
yaml.load is the obvious function to use but it is dangerous[1]
Because yaml.load return Python object may be dangerous if you
receive a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the
Internet. The function yaml.safe_load limits this ability to
simple Python objects like integers or lists.

In addition, Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace
all occurrences with yaml.safe_load(). Thus I replace yaml.load()
with yaml.safe_load()

[1]https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I4aac907c2a7ecf9a3f85a1a07ca020df6eb0b756
Closes-Bug: #1634265

revisions:

'alarm-listener' in Aodh would be deployed if you use charm-aodh.
It expects that ceilometer publish events with 'alarm.all' topic,
then it can evaluate alarm criteria pre-configured by users.

Change-Id: Id536c9d847ac9c08b9d7d309b4639606e6860a17

commit_message:
Add Aodh event-alarm support

'alarm-listener' in Aodh would be deployed if you use charm-aodh.
It expects that ceilometer publish events with 'alarm.all' topic,
then it can evaluate alarm criteria pre-configured by users.

This patch makes ceilometer publish events for event-driven alarm
evaluation in Aodh.

Change-Id: Id536c9d847ac9c08b9d7d309b4639606e6860a17

commit_message:
Fix response bootable parameter type in api document

This commit fixes the response bootable parameter type in the api
document. The type is string not boolean in the current code. And
the request parameter's type is boolean. I think this is an
inconsistency but we shouldn't change it to keep the backward
compatibility.

Change-Id: Ia0c70341f595580d12888e1f517e314fb98d4a6b

subject: Skip osd-devices not absolute paths
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-22 23:34:30.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'actions/add_disk.py', 'unit_tests/test_config.py'], 'message': "Skip osd-devices not absolute paths

This change skips over any devices which does not start with a leading
folder separator ('/'). Allowing such entries causes an OSD to be
created out of the charm directory. This can be caused by something as
innocuous as 2 spaces between devices. The result is that the root
device is also running an OSD, which is undesirable.

Change-Id: I0b5530dc4ec4306a9efedb090e583fb4e2089749
Closes-Bug: 1652175
"}]
commit_message:
Skip osd-devices not absolute paths

This change skips over any devices which does not start with a leading
folder separator ('/'). Allowing such entries causes an OSD to be
created out of the charm directory. This can be caused by something as
innocuous as 2 spaces between devices. The result is that the root
device is also running an OSD, which is undesirable.

Change-Id: I0b5530dc4ec4306a9efedb090e583fb4e2089749
Closes-Bug: 1652175

This patch enables the RHEL 7 STIG content tasks as the default.

commit_message:
Enable RHEL 7 STIG tasks as default [+Docs]

This patch enables the RHEL 7 STIG content tasks as the default.
Documentation has also been updated to reflect the change and provide
more concise information about what is available with each release.

The OpenStack-Ansible repo is still set to use the RHEL 6 STIG until
some issues with individual roles are resolved.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ic72d97b87c0fb16646e5a31030404e1a9ad6a469

Previously, if tag was not present in other_config obtained from ovsdb
for any reason, DEAD VLAN tag was used. This is not smart at all as it
puts all conntrack entries to one point. Also tag is mandatory and if
other_config doesn't contain it, it's a huge mistake that should never

Change-Id: I91ab75b52b70dbba4c7823550bfdfe0ab9396336
Related-bug: 1564947
"}]
commit_message:
ovsfw: Raise exception if tag cannot be found in other_config

Previously, if tag was not present in other_config obtained from ovsdb
for any reason, DEAD VLAN tag was used. This is not smart at all as it
puts all conntrack entries to one point. Also tag is mandatory and if
other_config doesn't contain it, it's a huge mistake that should never
happen.

Change-Id: I91ab75b52b70dbba4c7823550bfdfe0ab9396336
Related-bug: 1564947

subject: Don't send X-Auth- headers in requests
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-01-12 16:05:08.000000000', 'files': ['monascaclient/v2_0/alarm_definitions.py', 'monascaclient/v2_0/metrics.py', 'monascaclient/common/monasca_manager.py', 'monascaclient/v2_0/notifications.py', 'monascaclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'monascaclient/v2_0/alarms.py', 'monascaclient/common/http.py'], 'message': "Don't send X-Auth- headers in requests

From looking through monasca server code there is nowhere that is
actuall reading the X-Auth-User, X-Auth-Key, X-Auth-Url or X-Auth-Region
headers. The shell also enforces that a user provide keystone
authentication. This means we are sending the server a user's password
for no reason. They were initially added in the very first monascaclient
commit so assume they were unneeded and remove it.

Change-Id: Ic6e6dd1a14474537ab9180bb4af1a3fae09fc8a6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't send X-Auth- headers in requests

From looking through monasca server code there is nowhere that is
actuall reading the X-Auth-User, X-Auth-Key, X-Auth-Url or X-Auth-Region
headers. The shell also enforces that a user provide keystone
authentication. This means we are sending the server a user's password
for no reason. They were initially added in the very first monascaclient
commit so assume they were unneeded and remove it.

Change-Id: Ic6e6dd1a14474537ab9180bb4af1a3fae09fc8a6

commit_message:
Remove NovaNetworkPlugin

Nova network was deprecated in Newton and is no longer supported for
regular deployments in Ocata [1].

Complete the removal of nova network support from manila begun in [2]
by removing support for ''nova_net_id`` in the share networks API,
by removing the corresponding column from the share networks DB model,
and by removing the nova network plugins themselves.  Unit tests for
share network api views were refactored to remove redundancy while
extending coverage to the new microversion introduced with this patch
and maintaining full coverage of earlier microversions.

APIImpact
DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Partially-implements: bp remove-nova-net-plugin

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/unreleased.html
[2] I846b760fa7c01f7f86768399a2bfad9ced7e57cd

Change-Id: I8b9a559fbea61979f01737ed1dc272276c4f1269

subject: Clean up logging around write_bash_code
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-16 11:09:09.000000000', 'files': ['rst2bash/parser.py'], 'message': 'Clean up logging around write_bash_code

This patch removes code that is not needed.

The parser_message is redundant now that the logging system writes the
error messages.

The error message for write_bash_code never worked: if writing fails,
write_bash_code() throws an exception which is not caught and the user
gets a stacktrace that is actually quite helpful.

Change-Id: I1e54d65bab21ee78928fd90b0246d33e66c560d3
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up logging around write_bash_code

This patch removes code that is not needed.

The parser_message is redundant now that the logging system writes the
error messages.

The error message for write_bash_code never worked: if writing fails,
write_bash_code() throws an exception which is not caught and the user
gets a stacktrace that is actually quite helpful.

Change-Id: I1e54d65bab21ee78928fd90b0246d33e66c560d3

subject: Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 17:20:12.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/authtoken_manage_memcache_package-55f01f617aaa8db0.yaml', 'manifests/keystone/authtoken.pp', 'spec/classes/zaqar_keystone_authtoken_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

Change-Id: Id0d980618cd3816172e491b20058d540d6d1ed41
(cherry picked from commit aaaa38c198734b9aee4b3d32491c2473c1fc943b)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

Change-Id: Id0d980618cd3816172e491b20058d540d6d1ed41
(cherry picked from commit aaaa38c198734b9aee4b3d32491c2473c1fc943b)

subject: Delete kernel debug related parameter for performance
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-09 01:29:43.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/fuel_bootstrap/fuel_bootstrap_cli/fuel_bootstrap/settings.yaml.sample'], 'message': 'Delete kernel debug related parameter for performance

Those deleted kernel parameters are extremely heavy debug.
The boot process is rather slow on machines which has a
complicate motherboard and lots of pci devices(Lenovo RD640).
The debug process costs so much resouce, evetually it will impact
normal functions, such as cpus are so busy dealing with debug
info in kernelspace, they do not have time to reponse udev
event in userspace and failed to bring up pci devices.

Change-Id: I964c5fbc7f5b7d0ba6d1dd0166db3e4234179afa
Closes-bug: #1632592
(cherry picked from commit babe668c21283a412fc558d40b4f87fd33b69260)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete kernel debug related parameter for performance

Those deleted kernel parameters are extremely heavy debug.
The boot process is rather slow on machines which has a
complicate motherboard and lots of pci devices(Lenovo RD640).
The debug process costs so much resouce, evetually it will impact
normal functions, such as cpus are so busy dealing with debug
info in kernelspace, they do not have time to reponse udev
event in userspace and failed to bring up pci devices.

Change-Id: I964c5fbc7f5b7d0ba6d1dd0166db3e4234179afa
Closes-bug: #1632592
(cherry picked from commit babe668c21283a412fc558d40b4f87fd33b69260)

commit_message:
Update missing database exception text

The text given when there is a missing rally database was recently
changed. Update the 'Create/upgrade Rally DB schema' task to look for
the updated text so that the rally database can be created as required.

Change-Id: I705148e8e3a4691d6922ce295719c0785d9a8cfb

subject: [PoC] Updated 'basic' strategy to use Monasca
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-22 14:23:45.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/decision_engine/strategy/strategies/basic_consolidation.py', 'watcher/decision_engine/strategy/strategies/monasca_basic_consolidation.py', 'watcher/decision_engine/strategy/strategies/monasca2_basic.py'], 'message': "[PoC] Updated 'basic' strategy to use Monasca

In this changeset, I propose 2 ways of updating the basic
consolidation strategy to use metrics coming from Monasca instead

Partially-Implements: bluprint monasca-support

commit_message:
[PoC] Updated 'basic' strategy to use Monasca

In this changeset, I propose 2 ways of updating the basic
consolidation strategy to use metrics coming from Monasca instead
of Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I3ab9a6584581c97a47e7f78cf18cfc86b9e1a510
Partially-Implements: bluprint monasca-support
